settings.title: nature is our guide for ingredient selection.
settings.step_text: Our Omega-3 is sourced from sustainably harvested microalgae, the marine source that fish get their DHA and EPA from.

settings.title: nature is our guide for nutrient pairings.
settings.step_text: We pair our Omega-3 with its natural helper nutrients, like phospholipids and choline from sunflowers, for optimal absorption and performance in the body.

settings.title: nature is our guide for nutrient delivery.
settings.step_text: We deliver our Omega-3 in liposomes, natural molecular structures that facilitate nutrient protection and near-perfect absorption (a 5x improvement over standard fish oil pills). Liposomes are nature's way of carrying Omega-3 in breastmilk.

settings.title: Omega-3 is key during pregnancy.
settings.text: Pregnant women consuming long chain omega-3 fatty acids such as found in seafood, fish oil and algal oil can reduce the earliest and most risky preterm births by 42%, according to the Cochrane Review (2018). Pregnant women should try to achieve a DHA intake of around 500 mg/day during pregnancy. Women who don’t consume enough seafood, can receive DHA from prenatal supplements that contain DHA. Most DHA supplements are in a capsular form, however, a powder source that can be added to foods and beverages is now available for women who prefer not to take capsules.
settings.author: Susan Carlson, Ph. D.

settings.title: our values
settings.description: Everything we say and do is rooted in our core values. They serve as our guide as we develop new products and education, and grow our community.

settings.name: Julie Sawaya
settings.text: I discovered my passion for nutrition around my family dinner table. My dad (an MD) was diagnosed with diabetes when I was just 5 years old. His illness has had a profound effect on me, leading me to research, experience firsthand, and advocate for the connection between our health, our families and communities, and how we choose to nourish ourselves. My passion for nutrition only grew as I began my journey to motherhood, as the quality of our nourishment as mamas-to-be and new mamas quite literally impacts the health and well being of our entire family.

settings.name: Ryan Woodbury
settings.text: My interest in nutrition and health grew out of my interest in the environment. As a young girl in California, I started volunteering at a local aquarium, leading educational tours to teach kids about marine science and environmental advocacy. It was clear to me, even then, that our health as humans is directly connected to the health of our environment. Advocating for broader awareness of the human and environmental health connection has carried through much of my life. I believe fundamentally that nourishing mamas will directly support nourished communities and a nourished planet.

settings.title: meet our founders
settings.description: Through navigating our own fertility and nutrition journeys, we realized most prenatal nutrition information and products fall far short of empowering real nourishment for mamas-to-be. We started Needed to meet our needs and those of the thousands of women and health practitioners we’ve met along this journey. Needed empowers women to meet their biochemical nutritional needs, and to find nourishment beyond nutrition through better products, better identification of nutrition needs, education and community to support nourishment beyond nutritional needs alone.

settings.title: Dr. John Baldeschwieler
settings.description: Professor Baldeschwieler is a J. S. Johnson Professor of Chemistry, Emeritus at California Institute of Technology beginning his tenure there in 1973. He is a National Medal of Science recipient for his public service and scientific contributions, and worked as Deputy Director of the Office of Science and Technology in The White House from 1970-1972.  Professor Baldeschwieler has dedicated his career to the study and applicability of natural delivery systems, namely liposomal technology. While at Caltech, he was responsible for commercializing some of the first and most successful pharmaceutical liposomal applications. He founded Vestar, Inc. and served as the Chairman of its Board of Directors before it merged into NeXstar Pharmaceuticals, Inc. (acquired by Gilead, Inc.). He founded other companies, such as Combion, and served as Director of the Huntington Medical Research Institutes.  He taught at Harvard and Stanford before joining the faculty at Caltech. Professor Baldeschwieler completed his undergraduate studies in Chemical Engineering at Cornell University and earned a Ph.D. in Chemistry from University of California, Berkeley.

settings.title: Jill Castle, M.S. R.D.N
settings.description: First and foremost, Jill Castle is a pediatric nutritionist and childhood nutrition expert. She works with parents to help them best nourish their children with nutritious foods and recipes and effective feeding strategies, establishing healthy habits that last a lifetime. To Needed, Jill is a vital advisor to Needed, helping to inform our educational content for practitioners and consumers, alike.

settings.title: Dr. Crispin Eley
settings.description: Crispin is a research scientist and entrepreneur, focusing his efforts on product development for commercially viable liposomal formulations. Alongside Needed, Crispin is realizing his dream of harnessing the power of liposomes to deliver natural ingredients to improve your health and that of your community. Crispin holds both a B.A. (honors) and a Ph.D. in Chemistry from Oxford University.

settings.title: Dr. Leah Gordon
settings.description: Dr. Leah Gordon is near and dear to the Needed community. From identifying common consumer needs to informing product development to helping with ingredient selection, Dr. Leah plays an active role on Needed’s Advisory Board, informing the product pipeline. As a specialist in women’s health and an expert in integrative and functional medicine, she is able to cast a wide net across her patients’ overall health and go deeper into the root causes of their unique health issues. She is most passionate about natural hormone balancing, digestive health, pregnancy preparation, fertility, and the root causes of low sexual desire. Her warmth and genuine care for her patients and community come through the instant you meet her and see her smile.
settings.user_footer_link: see articles written and informed byDr. Leah Gordon

settings.title: Dr. Sarabenet Sequeira
settings.description: Dr. Sequeira is a Board Certified pediatrician who builds on her broad base of medical knowledge with an integrated approach to medicine. Influenced by a homeopathic approach to health, she appreciates the healing powers of many alternative systems of medicine. Dr. Sequiera has been an invaluable advisor, as we determined dosage for our first Omega-3 Liposomal Powder product.

settings.title: meet our advisors
settings.sub_title: Our advisors are comprised of scientists, health practitioners, and industry experts. Together, we develop nutrition products and education to address what's truly needed.

settings.title: for the fertility-focused woman
settings.text: Omega-3 is critical for overall egg health and hormonal function. It also supports a healthy inflammatory response; reducing excess inflammation could be a crucial component of increasing your fertility.

settings.title: for the pregnant mama-to-be
settings.text: Omega-3 supports baby’s cell growth, baby’s brain and eye development, healthy pregnancy, and mama’s mood.

settings.title: for the postpartum mama
settings.text: Omega-3 is a critical nutrient for a new mama’s recovery, mood, and wellbeing. And it positively influences higher concentration of DHA in breastmilk.

settings.title: From fertility through postpartum
settings.sub_title: Omega-3 is a critical nutrient for fertility, pregnancy, and postpartum health. It’s important to increase Omega-3 intake, as nutrient stores are often depleted during pregnancy because the body will always give preference to the baby’s optimal nourishment.

settings.title: Through nutrient testing, we realized we had serious nutrient deficiencies. Food alone wasn’t meeting our needs.
settings.text: As lifelong nutrition nerds, we were shocked to realize food wasn’t fully meeting our needs. Through nutrient testing, we discovered we were both seriously deficient in Omega-3 and other key nutrients for fertility, pregnancy, and postpartum well-being.

settings.title: We dug into the research and realized we were far from alone. Nearly all women have nutrient deficiencies, and prenatal vitamins were not making up the difference.
settings.text: 97% of women in the US take a prenatal supplement, yet 95%+ are still deficient in key nutrients.

settings.title: Most prenatal vitamins don’t include all the nutrients a woman needs for optimal nourishment.
settings.text: Most prenatals contain just enough nutrition to prevent birth defects and serious diseases--but fall far short of providing women all that we need for optimal fertility, pregnancies, and postpartum recovery. Critical nutrients like Omega-3 DHA + EPA, certain B Vitamins, Choline, and Magnesium are lacking from most prenatal vitamins, or when present, dosages are generally too low or nutrient forms are too difficult to absorb to meet a mama’s needs. And, they are missing other key components like Collagen Protein and Pre/Probiotics.

settings.title: Prenatal nutrition information is often confusing, incomplete, or just plain wrong.
settings.text: It’s difficult to find trusted, fundamental nutrition information focused on women’s nutrition needs before, during, and after pregnancy. Too often, nutrition information is incomplete, missing important nuances and not considering the whole context of nourishment.

settings.title: We started Needed to meet our needs and those of every mama-to-be.
settings.text: Our mission is to empower real nourishment in women on their journey to motherhood. We do this through helping mamas and mamas-to-be better identify their nutrition needs, creating supplements that truly work in meeting those needs, and building a supportive community of like-minded mamas and trusted health practitioners.

settings.title: Frequently Asked Questions
settings.description: learn more about our products, services, and more.

settings.title: How was Needed founded?
settings.faq_answer:
We met as friends, fellow-nutrition nerds, and “someday-to-be” mamas while studying at Stanford’s business school.

Through navigating our own fertility and nutrition journeys, we realized most prenatal nutrition information and products fall far short of empowering real nourishment for mamas-to-be. We started Needed to meet our needs and that of the thousands of women and health practitioners we’ve met along this journey. We’re on a mission to create broader nourishment through better products, information, and community. More about us here.

settings.title: Where is Needed located?
settings.faq_answer: Needed HQ is located in sunny West Los Angeles.

settings.title: How can I contact Needed?
settings.faq_answer: If you have any further questions, or just want to chat, you can email us at hello@thisisneeded.com or message us through Instagram at @nourishmentisneeded. We love hearing from you.

settings.title: How do I stay up-to-date with Needed?
settings.faq_answer: You can follow us on Instagram @nourishmentisneeded or subscribe to our newsletter via the field on the lower right of our homepage. And, be sure to visit our blog for existing and regularly updated educational content.

settings.title: How can I get involved in the Needed community?
settings.faq_answer: The Needed community is constantly growing, and we are so happy that you want to join us. There are several ways that you can get involved. Get started by following us on Instagram and signing up for our newsletter. If you are a health practitioner who would like to learn more about our Practitioner Referral Program, visit the Practitioners page. If you are a wellness professional, scientific researcher, or a curious consumer with great ideas, visit the Collaboration page.

settings.title: Is Needed hiring?
settings.faq_answer: We are always on the lookout for fellow nutrition nerds, operational whizzes, and education gurus to join our team. If you think you could be a good fit, please email hello@thisisneeded.com with your resume and why you'd like to join Needed.

settings.title: Do you have give-back initiatives?
settings.faq_answer:
Yes, Needed is working to expand access to better nutrition products and education to all women. Please find more information about our commitment to nourish mamas, including Mama Earth here. 

Through our community give back program, we are committed to donating product to pregnant and breastfeeding women in need, including through partnerships with healthcare clinics focused on serving these women.

Through our research partnership program, we contribute product and monetary support for much-needed nutrition research on fertility, pregnancy, and postpartum health.

We hope to close the gender health research gap that has disadvantaged women for too long.

We are a 1% for the Planet member. 

We are a pending B-Corporation, committed to the highest standards of verified social and environmental performance, public transparency, and legal accountability to balance profit and purpose.

settings.title: Why should I take the quiz?
settings.faq_answer: Whether you are a serious nutrition nerd, or just starting off on your nutrition journey, we believe in empowering our consumers with much-needed information on the fundamentals of nutrition. Our quiz is designed to educate you on the benefits of proper prenatal nutrition at every stage of life, and to help you determine which products are best for you based on your life stage and other needs.

settings.title: Can I edit my answers to the quiz that I have already taken?
settings.faq_answer: At this time, no. But, go ahead and take the quiz again.

settings.title: Can I take the quiz for someone else?
settings.faq_answer: Yes, we hope you will. Just be sure to answer the questions to the best accuracy you can.

settings.title: Should I retake the quiz as my needs or life stage changes?
settings.faq_answer: The only constant in nature is change, and that is the same with our bodies. We recognize that nothing in our world is static, so we recommend you retake the quiz as your life stage or lifestyle evolves.

settings.title: How does Needed select their ingredients?
settings.faq_answer: Nature is nuanced. We pay close attention to nutrient content, and only formulate with ingredients - naturally-derived or lab-produced - that work synergistically with the body. We use lab-synthesized ingredients over naturally-sourced when the quality and purity of natural sources don’t meet our strict standards. All ingredients are selected and dosed in partnership with leading practitioners and researchers.

settings.title: From where are Needed's ingredients sourced?
settings.faq_answer: Using the highest quality natural ingredients is important to us, which is why we only source from vendors who meet our quality standards and whose focus is on organic, non-GMO ingredients.

settings.title: Where are your products manufactured?
settings.faq_answer: Our products are all proudly manufactured in the USA in the highest quality GMP facilities. See notes per product in their respective sections.

settings.title: Who are Needed's Practitioner Referral Partners?
settings.faq_answer: Our Practitioner Referral Partners are champions of our community. They serve as product educators and help drive our mission to empower everyone to find true nourishment through nutrition, education, valued experiences, and so much more. We are so lucky to work with an amazing community of doctors, midwives, nutritionists, acupuncturist, doulas, health coaches, chiropractors and so many more. Join us in our mission to empower real nourishment in women on their motherhood journey.

settings.title: How do I become a Practitioner Referral Partner?
settings.faq_answer: Visit our Practitioners page, and submit an application. We will review your information and get back to you with next steps.

settings.title: What are the benefits of being a Practitioner Referral Partner?
settings.faq_answer:
Through these partnerships, we build a deep understanding of the nutrition needs practitioners are seeing with their patients and communities. Together, we create thoughtful nutrition products and education to meet these needs.

Additionally, our referral program rewards Practitioner Partners and their communities for prioritizing better nutrition. To learn more about the specific rewards program email us at practitioners@thisisneeded.com.

settings.title: Do I need to carry Needed product inventory to become a Practitioner Referral Partner?
settings.faq_answer: Instead of asking to order wholesale inventory, we provide our Practitioner Referral Partners with codes that are then shared with patients and clients. Then they may visit our site and shop directly from us, entering the code at checkout and attributing the sale to the appropriate Practitioner Referral Partner. If you are a practitioner who only sells wholesale supplements, please reach out to us at practitioners@thisisneeded.com to discuss how we can best serve your practice's needs.

settings.title: How do I reset my password?
settings.faq_answer: If you have forgotten your password, there is an option on the login page that will redirect you to enter the email address associated with your account. We will then send you an email with a link to reset your password. If you are still stuck, send us an email at hello@thisisneeded.com and we'll help you out.

settings.title: How do I confirm my account?
settings.faq_answer: Once you have created your account, you will receive a welcome email, confirming that your account has been activated.

settings.title: I've forgotten the email address I signed up with, what do I do?
settings.faq_answer: Email us at hello@thisisneeded.com, and we will help you out.

settings.title: How do I review my orders, order history, or quiz responses?
settings.faq_answer: You can review your orders and order history under the "my profile" tab, once you have logged in.

settings.title: Do I have to sign up for a subscription?
settings.faq_answer: No. However, we suggest a subscription and you can pause or cancel at any time.

settings.title: When will I be charged for my order each month?
settings.faq_answer: When you place your order, we will charge your payment method immediately, and bill and ship future orders every 30 days.

settings.title: How do I cancel or pause my subscription?
settings.faq_answer: We know that it can be a challenge to keep on top of your daily supplements. If you feel that you need to pause or cancel your subscription, you can do so through your online account at any time. Please note, however, that if your order is already on its way, your subscription adjustments will be reflected in your following order.

settings.title: How do I update my credit card or billing information?
settings.faq_answer: Simply log into your account to manage your billing and shipping preferences at any time. If you have trouble doing so, email us at hello@thisisneeded.com.

settings.title: Does Needed store my credit card information?
settings.faq_answer: Yes. However, we value customer safety, security, and privacy, so you can be certain that our payment system is very secure.

settings.title: How is my personal information (health-related and billing) protected through your website?
settings.faq_answer: See our privacy policy.

settings.title: Where can I find my tracking number?
settings.faq_answer: Once your order ships, you will receive an order confirmation and tracking email, which includes your tracking number.

settings.title: Are there any shipping fees?
settings.faq_answer: Outbound shipping within the US is free. For international orders, shipping fees apply. If you choose to return unopened products, we will send you a prepaid shipping label and deduct $10 from your return. We cannot accept returns on international orders.

settings.title: How do I change my shipping address?
settings.faq_answer: Simply log into your account to manage your shipping address. If your order has already processed, please reach out to hello@thisisneeded.com.

settings.title: What if I don't receive my order?
settings.faq_answer: Please reach out to us at hello@thisisneeded.com and we’ll help you track your order.

settings.title: Does Needed ship internationally?
settings.faq_answer: We do! We have partnered with Passport to ship orders internationally. Please note that shipping fees, duties, and taxes may apply and we cannot accept returns on international orders.

settings.title: How long will it take to receive my order?
settings.faq_answer: Domestic orders with in-stock products are estimated to arrive within 3 to 5 business days after leaving our warehouse. International shipping speeds vary by location, but typically arrive within 9 to 11 business days after leaving our warehouse. A shipping notification with tracking link is emailed to you as soon as your order ships.

settings.title: What is Needed's order cancellation and refund policy?
settings.faq_answer:
We want to make sure you love your Needed products, and our return/refund policy reflects this. Please note, though, that given the nature of our products, we are unable to accept returns or refunds on all orders. 


We sell sample packs of all powdered products, and we recommend trying before you buy a full size product if you are hesitant about taste. We do not offer refunds on sample packs or full size products due to taste preferences.


Unopened, sealed products may be returned for a refund, less a $10 return shipping charge will be deducted from your refund. Email us at hello@thisisneeded.com to commence your return. Please note that we cannot accept returns on international orders.


For reasons not covered above, we consider refunds on a case by case basis. Please note our products are designed to optimally nourish you -- that means there can be a transition period for your system to get used to the higher nutrient content in our products versus many which are minimal in their nutrition value. Please reach out if you have questions about getting started with our products, we are glad to help. 


If your order does not arrive safely, please email us at hello@thisisneeded.com for assistance.

settings.title: Can I cancel my order once it is placed?
settings.faq_answer: Unfortunately, due to our fast shipping speeds, we cannot cancel orders once they are placed. You are welcome to return unopened products to us. Reach out to hello@thisisneeded.com and we will generate a prepaid shipping label for you. $10 will be deducted from your return to cover the cost of shipping your items back to Needed.

settings.title: Is your packaging recyclable?
settings.faq_answer: Our Omega-3 carton, Pre/Probiotic bottle, and shipping boxes are recyclable. Unfortunately, our Prenatal Multi and Collagen gusset bags and Omega-3 packets are not at this time. We are always looking at ways to increase our sustainability and decrease our environmental impact, from our ingredient sourcing, to our packaging, fulfillment, and more, but have not found other options yet that properly protect the powders. Please find more information about our commitment to nourish mamas, including Mama Earth here.

settings.title: How can I best share Needed with my friends?
settings.faq_answer: Share Needed with your family and friends. Give $10, and get $10 off your next order.

settings.title: What are naturopathic and functional medicine doctors? Why do you design products with them?
settings.faq_answer:
Naturopathic doctors (ND) attend an accredited four-year, graduate-level medical school like an MD, but their program is focused on physiology, nutritional biochemistry, and complementary therapies such as herbal medicine and homeopathy. This training is incredibly important in designing supplements. Very few MDs have nutritional training as only 25% of accredited US MD Medical Schools require a single nutrition course. Functional medicine doctors may be NDs or MDs who have gone through additional training in preventive medicine. 

We also collaborate with a number of other practitioners and researchers in developing and vetting products including OB-GYNS, midwives, nutritionists, biochemists, and microbiologists.

settings.title: What makes Needed’s Prenatal Multi different from others?
settings.faq_answer: We work directly with practitioners to select nutrients that work best in the body, and dosages intended to fully nourish, unlike most prenatals that provide inadequate nutrient amounts and tough-to-absorb forms.

settings.title: Why powder?
settings.faq_answer: Powder allows our Prenatal Multi to deliver all of the vitamins, minerals, and botanicals needed for complete, comprehensive nourishment — many of the best nutrients are bulky and can’t fit into 1- or 2-a-day prenatal capsules. You’ll see that a number of nutrient dosages are quite unique including 550mg of Choline and 400mg of Magnesium. Powder is more easily absorbed into the body. There is no need for additives or coatings. And, it tastes great and is seamless to incorporate into daily meals, drinks, or snacks (like smoothies, protein bites, nut milks, and more).

settings.title: When should I start taking the Prenatal Multi?
settings.faq_answer:
Take it before, during, after pregnancy — and even beyond — for the nourishment you need to feel your best and avoid depletion, and to give your baby everything their body needs to thrive from the very start. We like to stress the importance of preconception nutritional preparation and postpartum recovery, so this product is for you even if you are a few years away from having kids or a few years postpartum. 

Why do the amounts of some of the nutrients in Prenatal Multi exceed the percent Daily Value?

We designed our Prenatal Multi for optimal nourishment rather than to meet bare minimum needs. Daily Values are set off of the Recommended Dietary Allowances (RDAs) which most often do not offer enough nutritional value.

settings.title: Is your Prenatal Multi vegan, allergen free, and Non-GMO?
settings.faq_answer:
Our Prenatal Multi is vegetarian, but not vegan. There are considerable sustainability questions around the common vegan source of Vitamin D3, lichen. Lichen is a moss-like organism that exists as a composite of fungus and algae. It is an important part of the Arctic tundra ecosystem and grows "extremely slowly", less than a millimeter per year. For this reason, we prefer a “mind-fully made” D3 originally sourced from lanolin. 

It is allergen free, meaning no milk, egg, fish, shellfish, tree nuts, peanuts, wheat, soy, and gluten. It is also free of GMOs, artificial colors, artificial flavors, preservatives, and other additives and fillers.

settings.title: Can my partner take the Multi?
settings.faq_answer: Yes! Our Prenatal Multi includes many nutrients supportive of men's health (and sperm) including Vitamin C, E, Folate, Zinc, Selenium, and Antioxidants. We make a daily duo smoothie almost every morning. We’re working on a specific formula for the men in our lives that will have a few more sperm boosters like CoQ10. In the meantime, our Conception Support Plan for Two is a great start.

settings.title: Will the Prenatal Multi make my urine bright yellow?
settings.faq_answer: It may at times, especially with consistent use. B Vitamins in particular can cause urine to change to a bright yellow hue. Your body is excreting what it doesn’t need. We use nutrients forms that are most easily absorbed by the body, but because we set dosages to be fully supportive, the nutrient amounts may sometimes be more than you need. At our dosages, this is not harmful in any way, but just a guarantee you hit optimal amounts. Less is not more in more mind!

settings.title: What is Omega-3?
settings.faq_answer: Omega-3 is critical fat for before, during, and after pregnancy. You cannot make Omega-3, and must obtain it from diet or supplementation. There are three main types of Omega-3, ALA, DHA, and EPA. ALA is found in plants like chia seeds, flax seeds, and walnuts. ALA needs to be converted into the DHA and EPA forms of Omega-3 in order to be used by the body. This conversion process is highly inefficient (often less than 1%), so it is important for mom and baby to consume DHA and EPA directly. Fatty fish and supplements are the two reliable dietary sources. Fish do not make the DHA and EPA, but instead bioaccumulate them from eating algae.

settings.title: What is a liposome and why is it the optimal way to deliver Omega-3?
settings.faq_answer: Liposomes are molecular structures found in nature, such as in breastmilk. Our liposomes pair Omega-3 with natural helper nutrients, including phospholipids from sunflowers. This pairing 1) facilitates near-perfect (90-95%) Omega-3 absorption, a 5x improvement over a standard pill and 2) protects the Omega-3 from harmful oxidation that leads to rancidity. And, as an extra benefit, the phospholipids are a source of Choline, which works synergistically with DHA in the body. Overall, liposomes ensure you and your baby to get more of the DHA and EPA you need.

settings.title: How do I know if I need Omega-3?
settings.faq_answer: Our testing kit can help. Many are surprised to find that even if they eat a lot of salmon and sardines, their Omega-3 levels are lower than optimal. Our’s were! And, research shows that up to 95% of women are deficient. Even if you are not deficient, the more Omega-3 in your diet the better you will feel, especially when you are building baby as ⅓ of his or her brain is made of Omega-3.

settings.title: Why is the dosage set at 300mg DHA + 150mg EPA?
settings.faq_answer: We set our dosage in partnership with leading scientists and health practitioners across modalities (including MDs, NDs, nutritionists, chinese medicine doctors, midvices, and other birth work professionals) based on research and in-practice experience. Our 300mg of DHA conforms to the American Pregnancy Association per day recommendation. A 2:1 ratio of DHA to EPA allows us to provide multiple benefits for mom and baby, as DHA and EPA have different and often complementary physiological effects. We recognize that some practitioners recommend higher dosages of Omega-3 for before, during and after pregnancy. Our clinical research suggests that most mamas and mamas-to-be do not need a higher dose than our product delivers, as our powder facilitates near-perfect (90-95%) Omega-3 absorption, a 5x improvement over a standard pill.

settings.title: Why powder?
settings.faq_answer: Our powdered format enables us to deliver the most nourishing formulation for mamas and mamas-to-be. It’s 5x better absorbed by the body than a standard pill, and is delivered with other needed nutrients that help your body use the Omega-3 DHA and EPA that you and your baby need.

settings.title: Is your Omega-3 vegan, allergen free, and Non-GMO?
settings.faq_answer:
Our Omega-3 is vegan, we source it from algae. Fish actually don’t make their own Omega-3 they just bioaccumulate it from algae.

It is allergen free, meaning no milk, egg, fish, shellfish, tree nuts, peanuts, wheat, soy, and gluten. It is also free of GMOs, artificial colors, artificial flavors, preservatives, and other additives and fillers.

settings.title: Why is there sugar in the Omega-3?
settings.faq_answer: A small amount of sugar ensures the stability of our liposomes. In nature, sugar plays a similar role for cell membranes. We do not use sugar for added sweetness. Rice starch replaces the need for some sugar.

settings.title: What's included with the test?
settings.faq_answer: The test kit includes a blood collection card, lancet, alcohol pad, gauze pad, bandage, and a prepaid return envelope. See here.

settings.title: What will my results tell me?
settings.faq_answer: The results provide your Omega-3 Index, a % measure of Omega-3s DHA + EPA in your blood.

settings.title: What is the target range for the Omega-3 Index?
settings.faq_answer: An Omega-3 Index in the range of 8-12% is one indicator of better overall health. An Index of 5% or less (which is common in the US) indicates the highest risk for not having enough Omega-3 for mom or baby in pregnancy.

settings.title: Why should I take this test rather than a blood-draw test ordered by my doctor?
settings.faq_answer: We use a single drop of blood to measure the Omega-3 Index. This eliminates the need to have your blood drawn at a clinic. You can collect your sample and send it through the mail from the comfort of your own home! And, it is highly accurate. Our testing partner, OmegaQuant, has led research on Omega-3 intake for 30 years, and has over 80 published research papers in this field.

settings.title: Does the finger prick hurt?
settings.faq_answer: The prick creates a slight pinch.

settings.title: Are there any risks to testing my Omega-3 levels?
settings.faq_answer:
There is minimal physical risk to you from the finger prick. The prick may cause a small amount of pain and bruising, and the site may bleed slightly for a time after the blood is collected. There is also a very rare chance that the stick site could become infected. If this happens, you might require medical treatment.

There is a very small risk associated with the collection of confidential health information. However, we are making every effort to protect your identity.

settings.title: How long will it take to receive my results?
settings.faq_answer: Your results will be ready within 2 to 3 weeks of our lab receiving your results by mail.

settings.title: How often should I re-rest my Omega-3 levels?
settings.faq_answer: Once you have begun your new supplementation routine, we suggest waiting at least 4 months before retesting to allow time for your body to replenish its stores of Omega-3.

settings.title: If I am deficient, how long will it take to improve my Omega-3 levels?
settings.faq_answer:
We suggest supplementing with a quality DHA + EPA like our Omega-3 powder right away. You may feel a difference within a couple of weeks, or, it can take a number of months. While DHA and EPA intake is the primary driver of your Omega-3 Index, your genes, overall health, and lifestyle can affect the Omega-3 Index response to dietary changes. For example, if you are breastfeeding or pregnant, it may take longer to improve your levels as you are still giving so much Omega-3 to baby.

If your Omega-3 Index level is below 5%, we suggest doubling-up on your dosage for a period of several months. It is ideal to re-test your levels after 3-6 months of continuous, daily supplementation when your starting levels are sub-optimal.

settings.title: Is it possible that my Omega-3 levels will be too high?
settings.faq_answer: Whether there is an upper limit of safety for the Index is not clear, but there is likely a value above which there is not likely to be any additional health benefit. We recommend an Omega-3 Index target value of 8-12% because this is where most research indicates a positive effect. Above 12% has not proven to be disadvantageous, but there is little research for high values. Research suggests up to 95% of women of childbearing age are failing to meet their Omega-3 needs. Of the nearly 250 health-conscious women of childbearing age whose Omega-3 levels we’ve tested thus far, 96% were found to be deficient in DHA+EPA.

settings.title: What is your privacy policy, and how will my results be used by Needed and OmegaQuant?
settings.faq_answer:
The results of your test will be kept strictly confidential.

Your results from the test are personal and private. Records will be kept confidential to the extent provided by federal, state, and local law. Only relevant Needed and OmegaQuant team members will have the right to look at your individual test results and records.

Your results will be grouped with the results from other individuals’ tests into a study. Needed and OmegaQuant may share results of this study in marketing, meetings, journals or other forums, but your individual identity will remain secret.

settings.title: How do I track my package, and what happens if it goes missing?
settings.faq_answer: We've partnered with Route, the leader in package protection and tracking solutions, to guarantee your products make it safely into your hands. We've covered the cost of Route+ on your order so it will be protected from damage, loss*, or theft. In the unfortunate case that your order never comes or is broken upon arrival, you can easily file a claim with Route and receive a replacement or be fully reimbursed. We are excited to offer this service to you at no additional cost! Claims for packages marked "delivered" must be filed after 5 days and before 15 days from the date the package was marked "delivered." Claims for packages presumed to be lost (where the status is not "delivered") must be filed after 7 (20 for international) days and within 30 days from the last checkpoint. You will receive an email from Route after your purchase with instructions on how to download Route’s mobile app for iOS from the App Store to visually track your package and receive real-time notifications on its estimated delivery.

settings.title: Are your products FDA approved?
settings.faq_answer: Our products are manufactured in accordance to the FDA’s current Good Manufacturing Practices (cGMPs), which help ensure quality and safety. Needed also completes third party lab testing for heavy metals, microbes, allergens, and other contaminants, helping to ensure our products are compliant within current guidelines and regulations. That said, by law, the FDA does not approve dietary supplements.

settings.desc:
Easy-to-take Prenatal Multi capsules with just the essentials your body and baby need.

Take it during the first trimester and beyond—when just the essentials are needed.

settings.title: Men's Complete Plan (Ships Monthly)
settings.desc: Bundle our 3 men's products for extra savings while optimally supporting your fertility and overall health.

settings.no_articles_text: Can't find what you are looking for? Drop us a note at hello@thisisneeded.com

settings.title: Dr. Phabillia Afflack, MD
settings.description: Dr. Phabby has over 15 years of experience in obstetrics, gynecology, and family planning. A Fellow of the American College of Obstetrics and Gynecology and a board-certified OBGYN, Phabillia Afflack, MD, has been practicing medicine since 2004.

settings.title: Dr. Leah Gordon, ND
settings.description: Dr. Leah Gordon is a naturopathic and functional medicine doctor, the owner of Womanhood Wellness™, a founding medical advisor for Needed, and a passionate speaker and educator. She helps women break up with birth control, balance their hormones, and boost their fertility through online programs and individualized, root-cause medicine. She is especially passionate about the trying to conceive journey and loves supporting couples naturally if they have to go through IVF, something her and her husband had to do because of male-factor infertility.

settings.title: Dr. Anthony Chin, MD
settings.description: Dr. Chin went to UCLA and graduated with a Bachelor of Science degree, majoring in Molecular Biology in 1991.  He then attended Medical School at UCLA to obtain his MD degree in 1995.  Later he completed his Internship and Residency in Obstetrics and Gynecology at Cedars Sinai Medical Center in 1999.

settings.title: Dr. Elliot Berlin
settings.description: Dr. Elliot Berlin is an award winning prenatal focused chiropractor, childbirth educator, labor support bodyworker, and co-founder of Berlin Wellness Group in Los Angeles, California. Through media such as documentaries, The Informed Pregnancy Podcast and stand up comedy, Dr. Berlin compiles and shares empowering information to help new and expectant parents make Informed healthcare choices.

settings.title: Ryann Kipping, MPH, RDN
settings.description: Ryann is a clinically trained Registered Dietitian Nutritionist, Author of The Feel-Good Pregnancy Cookbook, and master online nutrition educator. She is the founder of The Prenatal Nutritionist, a virtual nutrition private practice, which focuses on helping those trying to conceive and pregnant navigate the era of online information overwhelm.

settings.title: Dr. Ari Calhoun, ND
settings.description: Dr. Calhoun is a naturopathic doctor who guides her patients to a state of optimal health through the use of science-based natural therapies. She believes fully in the body’s ability to heal, and recognizes that addressing the root cause, rather than controlling the symptoms, is necessary for complete restoration. She has a special interest in hormone balancing, autoimmune disease, natural approaches to dermatology, and cardio metabolic disease.

settings.title: Carson Meyer
settings.description: Carson Meyer is a birth doula from Malibu, California.Carson is dedicated to supporting parents through a healthy and peaceful pregnancy, birth and postpartum period. With a passion for environmental health, Carson launched an all natural and sustainable skincare line, C & The Moon founded on the belief that the way we care for ourselves has a direct impact on how we care for the planet.

settings.title: Gina Conley, MS & Roxanne Albert, RN, BSN
settings.user_position: birth doula & labor and delivery nurse
settings.description: We are the founders of MamasteFit, providing full spectrum care from pregnancy, through birth, and recovery in the postpartum.Our services include: childbirth education, birth support, and fitness training. Both of us are US Army Veterans, mothers, and military spouses.

settings.title: Nikki Hunter-Greenaway
settings.description: Nikki Hunter-Greenaway aka Nurse Nikki is a family nurse practitioner, lactation consultant and owner of Bloom Maternal Health. This small but mighty medical practice provides postpartum and women’s health post-op house calls in Houston, Texas. Nurse Nikki is improving the way we care for women.

settings.title: Steph Greunke, MS, RD, CPT, PMH-C
settings.description: Stephanie Greunke is a registered dietitian that specializes in prenatal/postnatal nutrition, behavioral psychology, and holds additional certifications in perinatal mental health and fitness. She's the creator of Postpartum Reset, an online postpartum nutrition course, and the co-host of "Doctor Mom" podcast. Instead of dictating the treatment, she works with her patients in a team based approach. Her focus is to empower and educate her patients to become the healthiest version of themselves.

settings.title: Dr. Elana Roumell, ND
settings.description: When you meet Dr. Elana Roumell, you are immediately drawn to her invigorating energy and authenticity. She is a key contributor and adviser to Needed, providing great insight to product development and formulation. Dr. Elana is a Naturopathic Doctor, driven by a lifelong interest in health, medicine, and alternative options. She is especially passionate about pediatrics, and is committed to helping parents keep their children optimally healthy.

settings.title: Katya Mosely, L.Ac.
settings.description: Katya Mosely, L.Ac. is a perinatal-focused licensed acupuncturist, herbalist, and physician of Traditional Chinese Medicine. She is the founder and lead acupuncturist at Spirit Gate Acupuncture + Wellness, in West Los Angeles, where she focuses on optimizing the health, wellness, and vitality of each adult and child patient.

settings.title: Nimisha Gandhi, BS, CNC
settings.description: Nutritionist, mother, clinical researcher, and educator, Nimisha Gandhi is well-known for her work and life passion for reproductive health issues. Nimisha is a functional medicine nutritionist, certified Ayurvedic counselor, and certified Yoga Nidra teacher. She is the founder of Moon Cycle Nutrition. Nimisha works mainly with teens and prenatal and postpartum folks, focusing on the menstrual cycle, autoimmune conditions, and rebalancing the gut microbiome. Nimisha’s approach to mind-body-spirit wellness is deeply influenced by both ancient healing practices and modern medicine. Nimisha serves as a board member of several health and wellness companies and organizations, including FemTech Collective and Conscious Kitchen.

settings.title: Dr. Alyssa Berlin, PsyD
settings.description: Dr. Alyssa Berlin is a perinatal psychologist specializing in helping new parents transition comfortably to parenthood.

settings.title: Dr. Maxine Owusu, MD
settings.description: Dr. Maxine Owusu is a Board-Certified Emergency Medicine Physician. She is a native from NYC where she obtained her Bachelor of Science in Biology at Syracuse University and obtained her Doctor of Medicine (MD) at SUNY Upstate Medical. In 2017, she then completed her residency in Emergency Medicine at Northwell/LIJ Medical Center. She is also a budding entrepreneur and recently started a lifestyle brand called Shea Seasons that celebrates Pan-African culture and emphasizes self-love and care. Originally from NYC she now lives in Atlanta with her husband and two beautiful kids.

settings.title: Nikki Bergen
settings.user_position: perinatal fitness, founder of The Belle Method
settings.description: Nikki Bergen is the Creator of The Belle Method. She is a Master Pilates trainer and pelvic health expert with a passion for helping women feel confident and strong throughout pregnancy, postpartum and beyond.

settings.title: Dr. Stuart Fischbein, MD
settings.description: Stuart James Fischbein, MD was Board Certified in 1989 and became a Fellow of the American College of Obstetrics & Gynecology in 1990. He has been a practicing obstetrician in Southern California since completing his residency in 1986. While well trained at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center in the standard medical model of obstetrics he had the respect and vision to support the midwifery model of care and served as a backup consultant to many home and birthing center midwives for 25 years. In 1996 he founded The Woman’s Place for Health, Inc., a collaborative hospital-based practice of Certified Nurse Midwives and Obstetricians in Ventura County, California. Dr. Fischbein now practices community based birthing and works directly with home birthing midwives, through his practice Birthing Instincts with Dr. Stu, to offer hope for those women who prefer and respect a natural birthing environment and cannot find supportive practitioners for VBAC, twin and breech deliveries. He is an outspoken advocate of informed decision making, the midwifery model of care and human rights in childbirth, receiving the 2016 “Most Audacious” award from HRIC and the Association for Wholistic & Newborn Health.

settings.title: Blyss Young, LM, CPM
settings.description: Blyss Young, LM, CPM, is a home birth midwife, childbirth educator, placenta encapsulator and natural birth and family consultant. Through her guidance and love centered approach she supports families to birth in the ways that they feel most empowered. She is a firm believer in intuition, the sacredness and ritual of birth and the power of autonomy in birth. She has studied with both Dr. Stu Fischbein (LA's only home birth obstetrician) and many skilled midwives. She has been fortunate to learn the art of midwifery in addition to the unique skills of delivering Breech, Twins and VBACs. At the heart of all of her work is a deeply rooted belief in the brilliant design of the human body and the symbiotic relationship between baby and parent. She continues to strive to support the sacredness of birth as a rite of passage, in the hopes to resurrect lost traditions that can bring connection to our high tech low touch lives.

settings.title: Taylor Walker Sinning
settings.user_position: certified personal trainer, holistic health coach & fitness mode
settings.description: I’m Taylor. You could call me a “conveniently healthy” Certified Personal Trainer, Holistic Health Coach, and Fitness Model. My brand, Taylor Walker Fit, began as a fitness-focused blog and evolved with me as I added marriage and motherhood to the mix. Now “fit” not only represents fitness, but the ability to “fit” nutrition, self-care, and holistic wellness practices into the mom + wife + career equation in a realistic way.

settings.title: Dr. Pooja Mahtani
settings.description: Dr. Pooja Mahtani is a functional medicine nutritionist as well as the founder of Pooja Mahtani Wellness, a virtual functional nutrition practice specializing in women's health. It wasn't until Pooja's own health struggles with PCOS, NAFLD, and IBS that she discovered the immense healing power of food. Pooja has now made it her mission to help women achieve hormone health through a combination of cutting edge nutrition science and sustainable lifestyle changes.

settings.title: Dr. Gabriela Sheets, PhD
settings.description: Dr.Gabriela Sheets, PhD in human biology and microbiomics, conducted groundbreaking and award-winning research on the early development of the gut microbiome. She rapidly discovered the dearth of good practices and information regarding the immune and microbial systems in babies, which inspired her collaborations with parents, practitioners and researchers alike. She is passionate about ameliorating human suffering by supporting the flourishing of human microbiomes, one family at a time.

settings.title: Caley Alyssa
settings.user_position: yoga instructor & founder of the Caley Alyssa App
settings.description: Caley is a Yoga Instructor, Yoga Nidra Guide, and Founder of the Caley Alyssa App

settings.title: Dr. Nathan Riley, MD
settings.description: I’m Nathan. I’m a recovering conventional doctor. I was in school for most of life, trained in two medical specialties, then looked back and found myself disillusioned with the conventional maternity care model. Now, instead of serving the medical industrial complex, I serve women and their partners in achieving vitality. I have done extensive study in holistic lifestyle medicine, and my practice is based on the midwifery model. I borrow from Eastern traditions like Ayurvedic and Traditional Chinese Medicine, and I provide holistic support to healing and pregnancy long before I recommend surgery, hormonal contraception, or other pharmaceuticals. I have a background in Ironman distance triathlon, rock climbing, Crossfit, and olympic weightlifting. I am also a deep ecologist, herbalist, psychonaut, and perennial Burner.

settings.title: Emily Stanwyck
settings.description: Emily has been in the birth world for over 7 years as a birth doula, prenatal and postpartum trainer through Birthfit, and is a mom of two who lives and breathes optimal health!

settings.title: Madeline Given
settings.description: I’m a prenatal and postpartum nutritionist and lactation consultant. I’ve authored several anti-inflammatory cookbooks and currently serve women through one-on-one consults and through my online prenatal health database, operating as a monthly membership. I live in Southern California with my husband and two boys, who are almost 5 and 2.

settings.title: Dr. Ally Power, ND
settings.description: Dr. Ally is a naturopathic doctor with a particular passion for supporting mothers through their journey into motherhood. She believes mother's deserve comprehensive, nurturing care during this time period, and is there to support them through their unique journey. She is known for meeting mamas where they are at, with her simple yet thorough, evidence based, and effective treatment plans.

settings.title: Hillary Bennetts
settings.description: Hillary is a nutritionist and mama of 2 focused on women in the perinatal life stages.

settings.title: Aida Garcia-Toledo
settings.description: Aida Garcia-Toledo is a non-toxic living and sustainability expert based in Los Angeles, CA. Aida founded Non-Toxic Munchkin, now 3 Little Plums, over a decade ago after years of working as a journalist in order to share her expertise and help her community transition to a healthier, safer, more organic life...without the added stress. As a mom herself, Aida is passionate about researching, educating, and inspiring others to take on their non-toxic living journey by providing them the research, know how and tips to take ownership of their own journey.

settings.title: Kristin Brown, RD
settings.description: My name is Kristin and I help women craft a healthy life they love using delicious food and sustainable lifestyle practices. I show women that eating healthy and loving the food they eat CAN be done and that creating a lifestyle that is both healthy AND indulgent is the key to long term success. I have a Bachelor of Science in Human Nutrition from St. F.X. University and I am a Registered Dietitian located in New Brunswick offering virtual nutrition services all across Canada. I have been in the nutrition world for the past decade and love every minute of this ever-changing science. Although I have been trained in mainstream dietetics, I am passionate about integrative and functional medicine. I believe that food is the greatest form of medicine and that food choices based on ancestral patterns is one of the best ways to keep our bodies and minds healthy.

settings.title: Jessica Bippen, MS, RD
settings.description: I’m a Registered Dietitian Nutritionist with a Masters in Nutrition Therapy. On a deeper level, I’m recovering perfectionist and passionate-wellness-encourager. I believe in a forever approach to living well.

settings.title: Dr. Rory Gibbons, B.Sc, ND
settings.user_position: naturopathic doctor & co-founder of Virtual Health Collective
settings.description: Dr. Rory is a husband, father, naturopathic doctor, and co-founder of Virtual Health Collective. He specializes in dad & men's health and digestive health.

settings.title: Ivy Joeva
settings.description: Ivy Joeva is a doula, coach and educator serving women and couples throughout the childbearing year including fertility coaching, counseling for pregnancy loss of all kinds, holistic preparation for birth and postpartum recovery support. A graduate of UC Berkeley and the Institute for Integrative Nutrition, Ivy became a doula in 2009. She serves clients across the United States and abroad.

settings.title: Jackie Crown, DACM, L.Ac
settings.user_position: doctor of chinese medicine & postnatal health coach
settings.description: Jackie Crown, DACM, L.Ac is a postnatal health coach and licensed acupuncturist, utilizing her training in functional nutrition and Chinese medicine to support women in their journey through early motherhood.

settings.title: Jess Baumgardner
settings.description: I'm a health coach, doula and mom - my clients call me their wellness and birth concierge. I support people giving birth during every step of the journey - before, during and after. I want your experience of parenthood, at all stages, to leave you feeling deeply held, and prepared and confident in what's next.

settings.title: Haley Miskowiec, RD
settings.description: Haley Miskowiec is a Pre & postnatal Registered Dietitian who is on a mission to help women have confident, healthy, feel-good pre & postnatal journeys!

settings.title: Marissa McCormick, MS, RD
settings.description: I'm a mom, wife and dietitian with a passion for prenatal nutrition. Through my Instagram account, @nutrition4moms, I empower pregnant people to confidently navigate prenatal nutrition.

settings.title: McLean McGown
settings.description: McLean is a Postpartum Doula and Motherhood Coach who’s work centers around educating women, mothers and families as they navigate their life’s journey. Through a holistic lens of body, mind and spirit, McLean helps women to empower themselves. She uses various tools in her work including Nutrition, yoga, meditation, hypnosis, reiki, processing of the birth, Lactation Education, birth and postpartum education, couples work and family lineage work.

settings.title: Dr. Miranda Naylor, DO
settings.description: Dr. Naylor is an osteopathic doctor board-certified in Family Medicine and Functional Medicine. She is passionate about helping women uncover the root causes that are keeping them from optimal health. She specializes in women’s health, particularly preconception, fertility, pregnancy, and motherhood. She regularly treats thyroid, adrenal, and sex hormone imbalance, digestive concerns, autoimmunity, and mitochondrial health.

settings.title: Dani Rhoades & Whitney Eves
settings.description: Dani has spent the last 9+ years in practice specializing in nutritional care for preconception, prenatal + postpartum moms and babies. Whitney has 3 girls of her own and priceless experience raising them with the best nutrition in mind. Together Dani + Whit are the perfect combo of private practice + personal experience.

settings.title: Shanna Hutcheson, RD, LD
settings.description: Shanna Hutcheson is a Registered Dietitian, Health & Wellness Blogger and mama based in the Kansas City area.

settings.title: Brittany Anderson, RN, WHNP-BC
settings.user_position: integrative nurse practitioner + fitness & nutrition consultant
settings.description: Brittany Anderson is an integrative women’s health nurse practitioner turned functional medicine consultant, who is deeply passionate about supporting women and their partners from preconception through postpartum. In addition to her work in the clinical setting, Britt is an experienced fitness and nutrition coach, and birth doula. Britt is also a certified Mercier therapy practitioner and has incorporated this technique into her care for clients walking through everything from birth trauma to fertility challenges. Much of Britt’s work focuses on empowering women to step into their power and embrace the innate wisdom within their amazing bodies. Britt is married to her husband Chad and is a mother to three little boys. They have built a beautiful life and home just outside Nashville, TN.

settings.title: Arden Cartrette
settings.description: I’m Arden and I help women get through miscarriage and grief. Through being a Birth + Bereavement Doula and a Trauma Support Specialist, my priority is to help women navigate miscarriage, pregnancy after loss, trauma, and the grief that comes with the journey. Through private support, community, and digital content, The Miscarriage Doula is a resource and service that’s here to help women get through it all.

settings.title: Anabelle Clebaner MS, RDN
settings.description: I work exclusively with women trying to conceive using integrative and functional nutrition and a food as medicine approach.

settings.title: Cassy Joy Garcia
settings.description: Cassy Joy Garcia is a certified holistic nutritionist, a NY Times bestselling author, and a professional home cook. She is the founder of @fedandfit, a popular destination for healthy living, including easy dinnertime prep. She is the mama of 3 littles.

settings.title: Sonia Ribas
settings.description: Moms' health & fertility coach, certified yoga teacher & founder of Yogin’it

settings.title: Stephanie Matthias
settings.description: Stephanie has worked in the wellness space for over 14 years as a holistic chef, full-spectrum doula, women’s healer, reiki practitioner and wellness educator. she serves as an open-hearted guide for her clients- providing a wide range of healing support from a gentle, non-judgmental, holistic perspective. Stephanie currently sees one-on-one clients in Los Angeles- supporting women across all of their reproductive experiences and beyond- as well as leading one of the only abortion support groups in Los Angeles and teaching various workshops all in the vein of women’s wellness and reproductive health.

settings.title: Dr. Casie Danenhauer Humble
settings.description: Dr. Casie Danenhauer Humble is a Doctor of Physical Therapy and owner of Enlighten Physical Therapy in Culver City, CA. Her mission is to provide conscious care for her pelvic health clients through education and embodiment practices. She combines her skills as a pelvic floor PT and yoga instructor to facilitate a unique and holistic path towards healing both individually and in group settings. Her philosophy maintains a balance between evidence-based science and an integrative consideration of yoga therapy including the physical, emotional, energetic, and spiritual systems for maximizing whole body health.

settings.title: Abby Mercado
settings.description: Abby Mercado is the mommy of Max & Annie, 3-year-old IVF twins. She’s also a VC-investor-turned-entrepreneur who was inspired by her experience to improve the fertility industry through technology. Abby believes that the louder we are about infertility as a disease state that affects more than 1 in 8 Americans, the greater the access to care.

settings.title: Kristyn Hodgdon
settings.description: Kristyn Hodgdon is the Co-Founder and Chief Community Officer at Rescripted. She is also a professional writer, voracious reader, and IVF mom of twins. Through her work at Rescripted, Kristyn is focused on changing the narrative around fertility and rescripting the journey for the millions of people who are trying to conceive, struggling with infertility, or dealing with pregnancy loss. She lives in Long Island, NY with her husband Dan and their two children.

settings.title: Michelle Gerber, ND, LM, FABNP
settings.description: Naturopathic Doctor and Midwife, specializing in women's health, fertility and pregnancy, family care, and board certified in Naturopathic Pediatrics.

settings.title: Kinsey Olson, RN BSN
settings.description: Kinsey is a registered nurse specializing in women’s hormone + fertility, pediatrics and postpartum. She also supports families as a birth + postpartum doula. She founded Motherland Birth Co. and works virtually with women to get to the root cause and heal.

settings.title: Courtney Ursetti
settings.description: Courtney Ursetti is a mother of 2 daughter’s, a holistic birth mentor and wellness guide living in Los Angeles. Her mission is to change the narrative in how we think and feel in our approach to daily health and our journey into motherhood.

settings.title: Robyn Price, RD CBS
settings.description: Robyn is a Pediatric Registered Dietitian and Certified Breastfeeding Specialist. She is the founder of The Breastfeeding Dietitian, which focuses on helping moms KEEP breastfeeding without the worry, stress or guilt. Through education and empowerment, she helps parents solve their baby’s gas, reflux, and colic problems the “baby-led” way using her unique background by helping both mom’s diet and baby’s feeding.4

settings.title: Brittany Beaver, MS, RD, LD
settings.description: Brittany Beaver is a registered dietitian with a primary focus is pediatrics and pregnancy. She is passionate about nontoxic living and empowering women to make safer swaps for themselves and their families.

settings.title: Allegra Gast, RDN, IBCLC
settings.user_position: registered dietitian nutritionist, international board certified lactation consultant
settings.description: Allegra Gast is a functional registered dietitian and international board certified lactation consultant. She specializes in postpartum nutrition and ensuring both mom and baby are nourished.

settings.title: Tracy Shevell, MD
settings.description: Tracy is a High Risk OBGYN who has pivoted from direct hospital care to serving as a guide to help fix our broken system. Mothers and families are more disconnected from ever and their doctors are equally as frustrated. With 20 years of clinical experience, she created Blue Moon Perinatal as a navigational and support service to help women self educate, learn how to empower themselves medically and how to get the best care they can. It is her hope that this can be used to mend the disconnect of the current challenges women face in their childbearing years, from preconception to the postpartum period.

settings.title: Kristen Vucinich
settings.description: Kristen Vucinich is a pregnancy and postpartum nutrition specialist who is filling the gap between standard medical care and the true nutritional needs of motherhood. Her company, Heartfed, is an educational and emotional support system for women seeking to have a healthy pregnancy and postpartum experience, one rich in nutrients, knowledge, and empowerment.4

settings.title: Dr. Jessica Monroe, PhD, RD, LD
settings.description: Jessica is a registered dietitian providing functional nutrition counseling from preconception through postpartum. She is the owner of a private practice where she helps women with a range of services from looking for a root cause of their infertility through helping to nourish themselves and their babies during pregnancy.

settings.title: Soyona Rafatjah, MD
settings.description: Soyona Rafatjah is a board-certified Family Medicine Doctor. She is the Medical Director and owner of PrimeHealth, a Functional and Integrative medical practice in Denver, CO. Needed is the prenatal brand of choice for herself and her patients.

settings.title: Meet the Needed Changemakers
settings.sub_title: Needed Changemakers is a collective of women’s health practitioners that represent complete perinatal care. Their diverse experience and shared mission for optimal perinatal health inspire us to design products, provide education, and promote community empowerment and advocacy to change the perinatal nutrition paradigm and improve outcomes for all families.

settings.title: Practitioner Partners
settings.description: Our Practitioner Partners play an integral role in bringing wellness and nourishment to our greater community. Through our partnership, practitioners share their deep knowledge of patients' broader nutritional needs, so we can join together to develop thoughtful product and educational solutions.

settings.title: needed community events.
Join as a Needed Practitioner Referral Partner.
settings.description: Our Practitioner Referral Program rewards you for sharing our products and mission with your audience.

settings.section_title: You are Needed!
settings.section_sub_title: We hope you will join us. If you are ready, apply below.

settings.title: Start with the Prenatal Multi for an optimal you.
settings.description: Most prenatals meet bare minimum needs. Ours helps mamas thrive, not just survive.
settings.detail_list:
• Complete selection of 24 vitamins, minerals, and botanicals
  • Optimal nutrient forms like methyl form of Folate, and minerals bound to Glycine for digestive comfort
  • Dosages that are truly supportive, like 300mcg of active B12, and a full 550mg of Choline
  • Easy-to-take, vanilla flavored powder. Even mamas with nausea love it!
  • Formulated with practitioners who regularly test pregnant and nursing mamas' nutrient levels. So you know you're getting what's needed.!
  • Third-party tested for safety and purity.

settings.title: How we prove our products work.
settings.description:
We test and verify every product batch to ensure consistently high quality.

Our ingredients, manufacturing, and finished products are third-party lab tested for safety and efficacy. 

Our products are proven to work in real life, through rigorous testing with our community of health practitioners and real families.
settings.image_subtitle: Our liposomal Omega-3 is clinically-proven to be 5x better absorbed than standard fish oil pills.

settings.title: Nutrition for the journey to motherhood and beyond.
Brittany Forman
settings.description: Brittany is a nutritionist, community builder, wife, and mother. She is a health coach at Parsley Health and is the founder of CircleMoms. She strives to empower her patients, friends, and family members with the building blocks to successfully optimize their health through nutrition and lifestyle changes. Brittany is passionate about creating an environment for her family that fosters wellness physically, socially, and mentally.

settings.title: Anna Glennon
settings.description: Through her own journey, Anna Glennon learned the debilitating effects of chronic inflammation. Now, she is on a mission to help other women going through similar experiences. As an integrated nutrition health coach, she works with clients to help make lifestyle changes and choose health-promoting habits that produce real and lasting results.

settings.title: Stephanie Greunke
settings.description: Stephanie Greunke is a registered dietician who loves using the principles of naturopathic medicine when working with her clients. Her health plan recommendations not only include dietary recommendations, but fitness, stress and sleep management techniques. She strongly believes in the “food as medicine” approach, but also recognizes the need for intervention at multiple levels. Stephanie understands that one’s diet can be affected by emotional, psychological, and spiritual issues. She fully empathizes with her patients because she has had her own personal health and weight struggles. Instead of dictating the treatment, she works with her patients in a team based approach. Her focus is to empower and educate her patients to become the healthiest version of themselves.

settings.title: Dr. Emily Gutierrez
settings.description: Dr. Gutierrez has an extensive list of credentials - a doctorate from Johns Hopkins University, practitioner certification through the Institute of Functional Medicine, a masters degree from The University of Texas, board certification as a pediatric nurse practitioner and mental health specialist through the Pediatric Nursing Certification Board, and more. Beyond her impressive training, she is also a seasoned speaker, writer, and researcher. In her practice, she incorporates functional nutrition, genetics, immune, and environmental health into providing individualized medical care for her patients. Dr. Gutierrez is a passionate practitioner, delivering outstanding functional and integrative pediatric medical care and direct support to families committed to raising healthy, happy children.

settings.title: Ashley Koch
settings.description: Ashley Koch inspires families to make healthy choices in many facets of their lives that allow children to grow and thrive. She is passionate about providing parents with the tools and support to help their children create lifelong healthy relationships with food. With a focus on individualized plans, she works with families to make nutrition decisions and behavioral shifts that fit into their lives. She finds inspiration all around her - from Northern California grocery stores, to farmers markets, to the pediatrician’s office, to food blogs and cookbooks. She is currently pursuing her masters degree in Functional Medicine and Human Nutrition.

settings.title: Katya Mosely, L. Ac.
settings.description: Katya Mosely, L.Ac. is a California Board licensed acupuncturist, herbalist, and physician of Traditional Chinese Medicine. She practices at Spirit Gate Acupuncture + Wellness, in West Los Angeles, where she focuses on optimizing the health, wellness, and vitality of each adult and child patient.

settings.title: Lauren Rashap, C.C.N.
settings.description: Lauren Rashap is a force of passion when it comes to leading a healthy lifestyle. She is the third generation in her family to study, practice, and teach the art and science of achieving vibrant health through the power of organic foods, yoga, and meditation. Over her decades-long career, Lauren has played vital roles in widespread nutrition philosophies like the Zone Diet, developed one of the first, full-service “traveling spas”, and launched a one-of-a-kind consulting service offering hands-on cooking and nutrition workshops and organic skincare products. settings.title: Randi Zinn

Born from her own experience of motherhood, Beyond Mom is harnessing a movement of women who are taking back their right to self-love, self-care, and community as a pathway to fulfillment. Beyond Mom offers: The Going Beyond Podcast, curated events, speaking engagements, workshops, and retreats for Moms seeking Self.

settings.title: Jess Suchan
settings.description: Jess Suchan coaches her clients towards finding a life of bliss, free from fad diets, overexercising, and burnout. She believes that in order to change our habits, we must address the “holistic picture” and compassionately investigate how all areas of our lives are interconnected. After attending the Institute for Integrative Nutrition, she coaches clients privately and works in partnership with her mom, Candace Burch, who is a hormone health educator. She also leads a virtual group coaching course, hosts events and retreats, and is the creator of the Sexy Sugar Cleanse, a 20 day system reboot for weight release, increased energy levels, and hormone balance.

settings.title: Sapna Fliedner
settings.description:
Sapna Fliedner is a certified Integrative Holistic Health Coach and a firm believer in individualized dietary therapy to help her clients navigate the confusing theories at the forefront of our modern world. Her approach uses real, whole, local and organic foods to prevent and reverse disease, especially in children. 
Originally trained as a Family Nurse Practitioner, she is the co-founder of Raising Sages Integrative Pediatrics in Aliso Viejo, California along with her husband, Dr. Dane Fliedner. She works with children and adults who suffer from allergies, asthma, ADHD, digestive issues.

settings.title: Kelli Tennant
settings.description: Kelli Tennant is the host of the top rated podcast, Ceremony Wellness. Through her own journey healing from chronic illness and trauma, Kelli has curated a space for conversations that cover a wide range of topics in support of women's growth. Her guests, including world-renowned doctors, healers, mentors, speakers, coaches and authors, discuss authenticity, personal development, spirituality, sexuality, plant medicine, using food as medicine, relationships, communication and so much more. Nothing is off the table and everything is aimed at education, awareness and finding your unique truth.

settings.title: Lindsey Vestal

As an Occupational Therapist, she is a passionate promoter of bridging pelvic floor rehabilitation with lifestyle modifications while addressing the psychological impact that pelvic floor issues have on our everyday lives. She also offers online training courses for occupational therapists interested in pursuing the pelvic health specialty. Lindsey teaches pelvic anatomy and pelvic floor health for the Maha Mama pre- and postnatal yoga teacher training in NYC. She is an ongoing contributor to Well Rounded NY and Motherly. She has published in the NY Times, Family Circle, Romper, NY Mag, Harper’s Bizarre, US News + World Report.

After attending the Functional Medicine Coaching Academy under the Institute for Functional Medicine, she supports her clients privately by helping them make lasting diet and lifestyle changes. She believes that food is medicine and that there is no one size fits all approach. Her passion is helping others feel their best selves by reaching their health goals, increasing their energy, and finding a life of balance.
