settings.title: What is Omega-3?
settings.answer: Omega-3 is critical fat for before, during, and after pregnancy. You cannot make Omega-3, and must obtain it from diet or supplementation. There are three main types of Omega-3, ALA, DHA, and EPA. ALA is found in plants like chia seeds, flax seeds, and walnuts. ALA needs to be converted into the DHA and EPA forms of Omega-3 in order to be used by the body. This conversion process is highly inefficient (often less than 1%), so it is important for mom and baby to consume DHA and EPA directly. Fatty fish and supplements are the two reliable dietary sources. Fish do not make the DHA and EPA, but instead bioaccumulate them from eating algae.

settings.title: How do I know if I need Omega-3?
settings.answer: Our testing kit can help. Many are surprised to find that even if they eat a lot of salmon and sardines, their Omega-3 levels are lower than optimal. Our’s were! And, research shows that up to 95% of women are deficient. Even if you are not deficient, the more Omega-3 in your diet the better you will feel, especially when you are building baby as ⅓ of his or her brain is made of Omega-3.

settings.title: What is a liposome and why is it the optimal way to deliver Omega-3?
settings.answer: Liposomes are molecular structures found in nature, such as in breastmilk. Our liposomes pair Omega-3 with natural helper nutrients, including phospholipids from sunflowers. This pairing 1) facilitates near-perfect (90-95%) Omega-3 absorption, a 5x improvement over a standard pill and 2) protects the Omega-3 from harmful oxidation that leads to rancidity. And, as an extra benefit, the phospholipids are a source of Choline, which works synergistically with DHA in the body. Overall, liposomes ensure you and your baby to get more of the DHA and EPA you need.

settings.title: Why is the dosage set at 300mg DHA + 150mg EPA + 55mg choline?
settings.answer:
We set our dosage in partnership with leading scientists and health practitioners across modalities (including MDs, NDs, nutritionists, Chinese medicine doctors, midwives, and other birth work professionals) based on research and in-practice experience. Our 300mg of DHA conforms to the American Pregnancy Association per day recommendation. A 2:1 ratio of DHA to EPA allows us to provide multiple benefits for mom and baby, as DHA and EPA have different and often complementary physiological effects. And, as an added benefit to our Omega-3, the powder provides a good source of choline at 55mg.
We recognize that some practitioners recommend higher dosages of Omega-3 for before, during and after pregnancy. Our clinical research suggests that most mamas and mamas-to-be do not need a higher dose than our product delivers, as our powder facilitates near-perfect (90-95%) Omega-3 absorption, a 5x improvement over a standard pill.

settings.title: Why powder?
settings.answer: Our powdered format enables us to deliver the most nourishing formulation for mamas and mamas-to-be. It’s 5x better absorbed by the body than a standard pill, and is delivered with other needed nutrients that help your body use the Omega-3 DHA and EPA that you and your baby need.

settings.title: Is your Omega-3 vegan, allergen free, and Non-GMO?
settings.answer:
Our Omega-3 is vegan, we source it from algae. Fish actually don’t make their own Omega-3 they just bioaccumulate it from algae. 

It is allergen free, meaning no milk, egg, fish, shellfish, tree nuts, peanuts, wheat, soy, and gluten. It is also free of GMOs, artificial colors, artificial flavors, preservatives, and other additives and fillers.

settings.title: Why is there sugar in the Omega-3?
settings.answer: A small amount of sugar ensures the stability of our liposomes. In nature, sugar plays a similar role for cell membranes. We do not use sugar for added sweetness. Rice starch replaces the need for some sugar.

settings.title: Can I give it to my partner?
settings.answer: Yes, we do. We make a “couples smoothie” almost every morning mixing our Omega-3 with our Prenatal Multi and Collagen Protein. Conception is a two-way street. (We then separately take our Pre/Probiotic.)

settings.title: Where is the Omega-3 manufactured?
settings.answer:
The Omega-3 is manufactured in the United States in a proprietary facility we share with our scientific partners. The supply chain is so new for this product that we have not yet gotten third party certifications (think how much of the best farmers market product isn’t yet organic certified). However, our scientific team came out of the pharmaceutical industry, so they know how to ensure the highest quality manufacturing. And, we have worked extensively with regulatory experts to ensure everything follows the highest standards, often exceeding cGMP requirements. We’ll send you an email each month, a few days before we charge you and ship your next box. You can delay an order, or cancel your subscription at any time, right from your account page.
Your satisfaction is 100% guaranteed. If you aren’t completely satisfied, send us a note at hello@thisisneeded.com and we’ll be happy to help.

settings.title: What kind of testing do you do?
settings.answer: Our powder is expertly formulated and clinically validated by 10+ years of research and development, including through third-party clinical studies. We test every batch for performance and quality, including through third parties that test for nutritional content, pesticides and herbicides, heavy metals, microbes, allergens, and other contaminants.

settings.title: Everything makes me nauseous while I am pregnant, will your product work for me?
settings.answer: Many pregnant mamas find our product more pleasant to take than a pill, and can often find something palatable to mix the powder into, even while nauseated. However, do not stress if nothing is working for you in your early pregnancy, as baby draws most of the Omega-3 it needs in the third trimester, so you can pause your subscription and restart once your nausea has passed (soon, we hope!)

settings.title: Why should I start a subscription? How does a subscription work?
settings.answer: Daily, continuous supplementation is needed to maintain optimal Omega-3 levels for you and your baby before, during, and after pregnancy. Our subscription ensures you never miss a day of optimal nourishment. We’ll send you an email each month, a few days before we charge you and ship your next box. You can delay an order, or cancel your subscription at any time, right from your account page.

settings.title: Which products work best with the Omega-3?
settings.answer: Our products are designed to be taken together for optimal nutrition. We recommend pairing the Omega-3 powder with our Prenatal Multi, Pre/Probiotic, and Collagen Protein to fully support you and baby throughout pregnancy.

settings.title: I’m not yet pregnant or a mom, is your product still for me?
settings.answer: Yes, our product is tailored for before, during, and after pregnancy, but it is beneficial at all stages of life. Research suggests that a mom’s habits prior to conception influence her baby’s well-being not just at birth, but also for its entire lifetime. At every stage of life, the more Omega-3 in your diet, the better you will feel. So, it’s never too early to start a subscription.

settings.title: Why single-serve packets?
settings.answer: We try to minimize environmental impact wherever we can. However, Omega-3 is highly susceptible to rancidity. Our liposomes protect the Omega-3 from rancidity.  Our single-serve packaging is an extra measure of protection to keep our Omega-3 fresh and ready to deliver the biggest benefit for you and your baby.

settings.title: What happens if I miss a day? Or a few days?
settings.answer: Don't sweat it. We know how busy life can get. You can go ahead and double-up on your packets for any days missed. Going forward, we recommend that you try to take your Omega-3 everyday to see positive, long-lasting results.

settings.heading: Why test your levels
settings.description:
Up to 95% of women are deficient in Omega-3, and levels are often halved during pregnancy. An Omega-3 deficiency during pregnancy can lead to increased risk of pre-term labor. Postpartum Omega-3 deficiency can persist for years after pregnancy, impacting mama’s breastmilk DHA levels, brain function, mood and hormone balances, fertility, postpartum recovery, and more.
Testing your levels empowers you to better understand your unique Omega-3 needs, as a first step in optimizing you and your baby’s wellbeing.

settings.section_title: How it works
settings.section_subtitle: Our simple and safe blood collection method does not require a full blood draw or a trip to the doctor. One drop of blood from a finger prick is all that's needed to assess your Omega-3 status.

settings.item_desc: Omega-3 levels start changing as soon as you change your diet and supplementation routine, and stabilize in 3-4 months.
Personalized dietary recommendations based off your test results.
All samples are processed in a central CLIA-certified laboratory.
The same validated and standardized sample processing methodology used in over 200 research studies.
Percentile ranks show you how you compare to your peers.

settings.section_title: We've partnered with the leading experts on Omega-3 nutrient testing, OmegaQuant.
settings.section_desc: OmegaQuant is an independent, CLIA-certified lab that offers Omega-3 Index testing to researchers, clinicians and the public and sets the standard for Omega-3 testing.
settings.section_bottom_text: Read more about why we partnered with OmegaQuant.

settings.title: What's included with the test?
settings.answer: The test kit includes a blood collection card, lancet, alcohol pad, gauze pad, bandage, and a prepaid return envelope. See here.

settings.title: What will my results tell me?
settings.answer: The results provide your Omega-3 Index, a % measure of Omega-3s DHA + EPA in your blood.

settings.title: What is the target range for the Omega-3 Index?
settings.answer: An Omega-3 Index in the range of 8-12% is one indicator of better overall health. An Index of 5% or less (which is common in the US) indicates the highest risk for not having enough Omega-3 for mom or baby in pregnancy.

settings.title: Why should I take this test rather than a blood-draw test ordered by my doctor?
settings.answer: We use a single drop of blood to measure the Omega-3 Index. This eliminates the need to have your blood drawn at a clinic. You can collect your sample and send it through the mail from the comfort of your own home! And, it is highly accurate. Our testing partner, OmegaQuant, has led research on Omega-3 intake for 30 years, and has over 80 published research papers in this field.

settings.title: Does the finger prick hurt?
settings.answer: The prick creates a slight pinch.

settings.title: Are there any risks to testing my Omega-3 levels?
settings.answer:
There is minimal physical risk to you from the finger prick. The prick may cause a small amount of pain and bruising, and the site may bleed slightly for a time after the blood is collected. There is also a very rare chance that the stick site could become infected. If this happens, you might require medical treatment.

There is a very small risk associated with the collection of confidential health information. However, we are making every effort to protect your identity.

settings.title: How long will it take to receive my results?
settings.answer: Your results will be ready within 2 to 3 weeks of our lab receiving your results by mail.

settings.title: How often should I re-rest my Omega-3 levels?
settings.answer: Once you have begun your new supplementation routine, we suggest waiting at least 4 months before retesting to allow time for your body to replenish its stores of Omega-3.

settings.title: If I am deficient, how long will it take to improve my Omega-3 levels?
settings.answer:
We suggest supplementing with a quality DHA + EPA like our Omega-3+ capsules right away. You may feel a difference within a couple of weeks, or, it can take a number of months. While DHA and EPA intake is the primary driver of your Omega-3 Index, your genes, overall health, and lifestyle can affect the Omega-3 Index response to dietary changes. For example, if you are breastfeeding or pregnant, it may take longer to improve your levels as you are still giving so much Omega-3 to baby.

If your Omega-3 Index level is below 5%, we suggest doubling-up the Omega-3 dosage for a period of several months. It is ideal to re-test your levels after 3-6 months of continuous, daily supplementation when your starting levels are sub-optimal.

settings.title: Is it possible that my Omega-3 levels will be too high?
settings.answer: Whether there is an upper limit of safety for the Index is not clear, but there is likely a value above which there is not likely to be any additional health benefit. We recommend an Omega-3 Index target value of 8-12% because this is where most research indicates a positive effect.  Above 12% has not proven to be disadvantageous, but there is little research for high values. Research suggests up to 95% of women of childbearing age are failing to meet their Omega-3 needs. Of the nearly 250 health-conscious women of childbearing age whose Omega-3 levels we’ve tested thus far, 96% were found to be deficient in DHA+EPA.

settings.title: What is your privacy policy, and how will my results be used by Needed and OmegaQuant?
settings.answer:
The results of your test will be kept strictly confidential.

Your results from the test are personal and private. Records will be kept confidential to the extent provided by federal, state, and local law. Only relevant Needed and OmegaQuant team members will have the right to look at your individual test results and records.

Your results will be grouped with the results from other individuals’ tests into a study. Needed and OmegaQuant may share results of this study in marketing, meetings, journals or other forums, but your individual identity will remain secret.

settings.title: Our liposomes ensure optimal nutrient absorption and protection.
settings.description1: Pair Omega-3 with natural helper nutrients, including phospholipids from sunflowers. Our phospholipids contain Choline, a nutrient that works synergistically with DHA and further supports a healthy pregnancy.*
settings.description2: Facilitate near-perfect (90-95%) Omega-3 absorption, a 5x improvement over a standard pill.*
settings.description3: Protect the Omega-3 from harmful oxidation that leads to rancidity.*
settings.description_bottom: Really want to dig-into liposomes? Read our deep-dive, and the results of our clinical study.

settings.content: Liposomes are molecular structures found in nature, such as in breastmilk, that facilitate nutrient absorption and protection. They allow us to deliver an Omega-3 that’s 5x better absorbed by the body than a standard pill, along with other needed nutrients, like choline, that help your body use the Omega-3 DHA and EPA that you and your baby need. In addition, liposomes protect our Omega-3 from harmful oxidation that leads to rancidity.

Liposomes are spherical molecular structures found in nature comprised of phospholipids, a type of fat present in all cells of the body. Liposomes facilitate near-perfect nutrient absorption and protection. In our liposomes, individual molecules of the fat-soluble nutrient Omega-3 are dispersed within a single bilayer of phospholipids, sitting within one molecular width from the surface of the liposome. The structure, in size and molecular arrangement, mimics that of naturally occurring liposomes, such as in breastmilk. In this form, the body recognizes the nutrients as “ready” to enter the final stages of digestion and nutrient absorption, bypassing the multi-stage (and often incomplete) interaction with intestinal fluids that is otherwise needed to break down and repackage nutrients prior to absorption. The liposomes allow us to deliver an Omega-3 that’s 5x better absorbed by the body than a standard pill. In addition, our phospholipids are derived from sunflower lecithin, which breaks down into choline, a key nutrient which supports optimal utilization of Omega 3- DHA and EPA within the body. Our liposomes also protect the Omega-3 from harmful oxidation that leads to rancidity in many other Omega-3 supplements. Overall, our liposomes ensure you and your baby to get more of the nutrients you need.
Really want to dig-into liposomes? Read our deep-dive here, and the results of our clinical study here.

settings.heading: Liposomes-why nature selects them for optimal nutrient delivery.
Proven absorption that rivals nature.
settings.sub_heading: Our liposomal Omega-3 is clinically-proven to be 5x better absorbed than standard fish oil pills.
settings.description: A recently completed long chain fatty acid plasma PK study with Huntington Medical Research Institute evaluated the absorption benefits of Needed’s liposomes against triglyceride gel caps. Both the liposomes and the gel caps contained Omega-3 DHA and EPA triglycerides from algae (i.e. where fish naturally get their DHA and EPA). The study also compared the absorption of DHA and EPA from the liposomes against published norms for DHA and EPA uptake from whole oily fish and ethyl ester gel gaps.

settings.heading: Our expert partners
settings.sub_heading: We’ve partnered with the leading experts on natural nutrient delivery to create our liposomal products. Our expert team of researchers and biochemists have over 40+ years of experience in replicating nature’s optimal nutrient delivery method.
settings.mem_1_desc: Crispin is a research scientist and entrepreneur, focusing his efforts on product development for commercially viable liposomal formulations. Alongside Needed, Crispin is realizing his dream of harnessing the power of liposomes to deliver natural ingredients to improve women’s and family health. Crispin holds both a B.A. (honors) and a Ph.D. in Chemistry from Oxford University.
settings.mem_2_desc:
Professor Baldeschwieler is a J. S. Johnson Professor of Chemistry, Emeritus at California Institute of Technology beginning his tenure there in 1973. He is a National Medal of Science recipient for his public service and scientific contributions, and worked as Deputy Director of the Office of Science and Technology in The White House from 1970-1972. Professor Baldeschwieler has dedicated his career to the study and applicability of natural delivery systems, namely liposomal technology.

While at Caltech, he was responsible for commercializing some of the first and most successful pharmaceutical liposomal applications. He founded Vestar, Inc. and served as the Chairman of its Board of Directors before it merged into NeXstar Pharmaceuticals, Inc. (acquired by Gilead, Inc.). He founded other companies, such as Combion, and served as Director of the Huntington Medical Research Institutes. He taught at Harvard and Stanford before joining the faculty at Caltech. Professor Baldeschwieler completed his undergraduate studies in Chemical Engineering at Cornell University and earned a Ph.D. in Chemistry from University of California, Berkeley.
settings.btm_title: We further substantiate our products through our network of trusted health practitioners

settings.title: Needed+OmegaQuant Omega-3 Testing of Healthy Women of Childbearing Age
settings.answer: Needed, in partnership with OmegaQuant, the leading experts on Omega-3 DHA and EPA nutrient testing, tested the Omega-3 status of 241 nutritionally-aware women of childbearing age, and found that 96.3% were not meeting their Omega-3 needs (Omega-3 index <8%), and 41.9% were critically low in Omega-3 (Omega-3 index <5%), as of the testing date. This testing was conducted over 6 months with participants from across the country, including integrative doctors, doulas, acupuncturists, nutritionists, and other health-minded women who attended wellness events including Attune in Georgia, Ceremony Wellness in Los Angeles, In Good Company in San Francisco, and the DONA International Doula Conference in Houston. Read the full testing results here.

settings.title: Dietary Intakes of EPA and DHA Omega-3 Fatty Acids among US Childbearing-Age and Pregnant Women: An Analysis of NHANES 2001-2014
settings.answer: Researchers reviewed National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey (NHANES) data from cycles 2001–2002 through 2013–2014 to determine trends in EPA and DHA intakes among childbearing-age and pregnant women including usual intakes and percentage not meeting recommended intakes from The 2015–2020 Dietary Guidelines for Americans (DGA). It was estimated that over 95% of women of childbearing-age did not meet the recommended daily intakes of 250 mg EPA and DHA through seafood or supplementation. Similar results were observed for pregnant women. Read the full study and abstract here.

settings.title: Omega‐3 Fatty Acid Addition During Pregnancy
settings.answer: In an updated Cochrane systematic review, researchers combined all published randomized controlled trials investigating the effect of Omega-3 long-chain fats during pregnancy on outcomes for mothers and babies. A total of 70 randomised controlled trials, involving almost 20,000 women, were included in the review. The review found that supplementation with Omega-3 during pregnancy: 1) lowers the risk of having a preterm baby <37 weeks’ by 11% (from 134 per 1,000 to 119 per 1,000 births) 2) lowers the risk of having an early preterm baby <34 weeks’ by 42% (from 46 per 1,000 to 27 per 1,000 births), and 3) reduces the risk of having a low birth weight baby <2,500g by 10% (from 156 per 1,000 to 140 per 1,000 births). Read the full study and abstract here.

settings.title: Omega-3 Fatty Acid Supplementation During Pregnancy
settings.answer: Researchers from Obstetrics & Gynecology reviewed literature to present information about how the absolute and relative concentrations of omega-3 fatty acids affect pregnancy outcome and fetal neurodevelopment. They eloquently summarize the importance of DHA and EPA and their role in pregnancy. Read the full study and abstract here.

settings.title: Importance of a Balanced Omega-6/Omega-3 Ratio for the Maintenance of Health
settings.answer: Researchers examined changes in dietary patterns that have led to reduced consumption of Omega-3 fatty acids and the importance of the Omega-6 / Omega-3 balance in maintaining good health. In addition, the researchers reviewed the established recommendations for preventing a poor intake of Omega-3, and possible options for compensating the lack of Omega-3 in the current diet. The researchers found that most studies indicate that the Omega-3 / Omega-6 ratio should be lower than that presently found in the general population and stressed the importance of promoting nutritional education programs that stress the need to increase the consumption of Omega-3. Read the full study and abstract here.

settings.title: Dietary (n-3) Fatty acids and Brain Development
settings.answer: Published in the Journal of Nutrition, a researcher reviewed recent studies on the role of DHA in brain development and function shedding additional light on the processes by which DHA is incorporated into a rapidly developing brain in utero and where DHA supports the formation of neurons and protects the brain from inflammation and damage, in infants and children, as well as at other stages of the lifespan. Read the full study and abstract here.

settings.title: High levels of anti-inflammatory and pro-resolving lipid mediators lipoxins and resolvins and declining docosahexaenoic acid levels in human milk during the first month of lactation
settings.answer: Researchers evaluated the composition of 94 human milk samples from 30 mothers over the first month of lactation. Data from the study suggests that DHA levels in the milk can decline by up to half in just the first month of nursing. Read the full study and abstract here.

settings.title: A Prenatal DHA Test to Help Identify Women at Increased Risk for Early Preterm Birth: A Proposal
settings.answer: Researchers summarize the evidence linking blood DHA levels with the risk for preterm birth. They propose that women who are pregnant or trying to become pregnant build a red blood cell (RBC) DHA value of at least 5% (of total RBC fatty acids). In the US, ~70% of women of childbearing age are likely below this 5% cut-off point. Read the full study and abstract here.

settings.title: Effect of prenatal EPA and DHA on maternal and umbilical cord blood cytokines
settings.answer:
Researchers performed this study to investigate the effect of prenatal eicosapentaenoic acid (EPA)- and docosahexaenoic acid (DHA)- rich fish oil supplementation on maternal and fetal cytokine production, an indicator of inflammation associated with many complications in pregnancy. They enrolled 126 women, of whom 118 completed the trial. Prenatal supplementation with EPA-rich fish oil significantly lowered certain maternal cytokine concentrations. However, supplementation with DHA-rich fish oil had no significant effect on maternal cytokine profiles. Neither had an effect on umbilical cord blood cytokine concentrations. Read the full study and abstract here.

settings.item_description: as 50% Beta Carotene and as 50% Retinyl Palmitate
settings.mobile_item_description: as 50% Beta Carotene and as 50% Retinyl Palmitate
settings.item_content: Retinyl Palmitate is an active form that is more readily usable by the body. Beta Carotene is often poorly absorbed and inefficiently converted into the active form. And, many women have a genetic variation that prevents the conversion completely. settings.item_content: Vitamin D3 is technically not a vitamin, but a prohormone. Prohormones are the building blocks of fully formed hormones. Your skin produces Vitamin D3 when it is exposed to sunlight. But, most mamas don't get enough sun and Vitamin D is difficult to get from food. In addition, many women contain genetic variations that predispose them to lower levels of Vitamin D. Vitamin D3 is more readily used by the body than Vitamin D2. Our dose provides enough to be effective, while still being safe for all mamas and mamas-to-be.

settings.item_content: Methylfolate paired with Glucosamine Salt is bioavailable and ready to be used by the body. We avoid Folic Acid, as it is unusable or harmful for many mamas. The unmethylated Folate form found in plants is not readily converted into the usable Methylfolate form. Our dosage provides enough Folate to be effective, especially for those with conversion difficulty, while still being safe for all mamas and mamas-to-be. settings.title: Why do I need a Collagen Protein?
settings.answer: Protein requirements are elevated during pregnancy. Mamas need protein for blood sugar management, minimizing nausea, and to grow baby's cells and the placenta. Collagen Protein has certain amino acids that aren’t readily available in other common protein sources that support mama's joints, pelvic floor tissue, skin elasticity, immune system, and gut health.

settings.title: Can I give it to my partner?
settings.answer: Yes, we do. We make a “couples smoothie” almost every morning mixing our Collagen Protein with our Prenatal Multi and Omega-3. Conception is a two-way street. (We then separately take our Pre/Probiotic.)

settings.title: Where is the Collagen Protein manufactured?
settings.answer: The Collagen Protein is manufactured in the United States at a FDA, GMP and QAI Certified Organic facility.

settings.title: What kind of testing do you do?
settings.answer: We test every batch for performance and quality, including through third parties that test for nutrient content, pesticides and herbicides, heavy metals, microbes, allergens, and other contaminants.

settings.title: Everything makes me nauseous when pregnant, will your product work for me?
settings.answer: Yes, protein is known to help minimize nausea. Our Collagen Protein is easy to incorporate into the meals or beverages that sound appealing like smoothies, oatmeal, lattes, etc. For more recipes and ideas click here.

settings.title: Which products work best with Collagen Protein?
settings.answer: Our products are designed to be taken together for optimal nutrition. We recommend pairing the Collagen Protein with our Prenatal Multi, Omega-3+, and  Pre/Probiotic to fully support you and baby throughout pregnancy. Shop our Complete Plan and save.

settings.title: Why should I start a subscription? How does a subscription work?
settings.answer: Daily, continuous supplementation is needed to maintain optimal levels for you and your baby before, during, and after pregnancy. Our subscription ensures you never miss a day of optimal nourishment. We’ll send you an email each month, a few days before we charge you and ship your next box. You can delay an order, or cancel your subscription at any time, right from your account page.

settings.title: I'm not yet pregnant or a mom, is your product still for me?
settings.answer: Yes, our product is tailored for before, during, and after pregnancy, but it is beneficial at all stages of life. It’s never too early or too late to start reaping the benefits -- healthy tissues to your immune system.

settings.title: What happens if I miss a day? Or a few days?
settings.answer: Don't sweat it. We know how busy life can get. We suggest building your Collagen Protein consumption into an existing routine (like your morning smoothie), to keep the habit strong. Taking your Collagen Protein every day will provide positive, long-lasting results.

settings.title: Why do I need a Pre/Probiotic?
settings.answer: A strong and healthy microbiome (digestive system, skin, vagina) is needed for a healthy pregnancy — for you and baby. What you eat is the number one determiner or microbiome health, but because the health of mama's microbiome is so important during pregnancy and it can be difficult to get enough of certain key strains from food, we highly recommend supplementing with our tailored Pre/Probiotic.

settings.title: How is your Pre/Probiotic designed for mamas and mamas-to-be?
settings.answer: Our Pre/Probiotic is formulated in partnership with leading microbiome experts to give you the targeted strains you need, and to seed your baby’s microbiome for optimal health. It is formulated to protect vaginal and gut microbiomes; boost maternal and infant immune functions; balance mood; optimize digestion; and support healthy blood sugar and pressure.

settings.title: Is your Pre/Probiotic vegan, allergen free, and Non-GMO?
settings.answer: It is vegan and allergen free, meaning no milk, egg, fish, shellfish, tree nuts, peanuts, wheat, soy, and gluten. It is also free of GMOs, artificial colors, artificial flavors, preservatives, and other additives and fillers.

settings.title: Where is the Pre/Probiotic manufactured?
settings.answer: The Pre/Probiotic is manufactured in the United States at a FDA, GMP and NSF Certified facility.

settings.title: Do I need to refrigerate the Pre/Probiotic?
settings.answer: We suggest storing at room temperature or cooler. Refrigeration is not necessary unless your home is consistently 79° F or warmer for extended periods.

settings.title: Are the capsules enteric coated?
settings.answer: No, the capsules are not enteric coated. Research shows that our strains do not require enteric coated capsules to deliver the same benefits. The capsules are just a delivery system. That's why it's okay to open them up.

settings.title: Could I experience some discomfort at the start of taking the Pre/Probiotic?
settings.answer:
Possible symptoms may include abdominal cramping, loose stools, and changes in bowel movements. Though these symptoms may be uncomfortable, they are a sign that the product is working! Symptoms should resolve within 2-3 days.

We suggest taking the capsules as follows for your system to adjust: Week 1: Take 1 capsule every other day, Week 2: Take 1 capsule daily, Week 3+: Take 2 capsules daily.

settings.title: What kind of testing do you do?
settings.answer: We test every batch for performance and quality, including through third parties that test for strain content, pesticides and herbicides, heavy metals, microbes, allergens, and other contaminants.

settings.title: Everything makes me nauseous while I am pregnant, will your product work for me?
settings.answer: Our Pre/Probiotic offers the flexibility to swallow the two capsule whole or break it open and mix the powder into food or drink. Many pregnant mamas find that something will work for them, despite nausea.

settings.title: Which products work best with the Pre/Probiotic?
settings.answer: Our products are designed to be taken together for optimal nutrition. We recommend pairing the Pre/Probiotic with our Omega-3+, Collagen Protein, and Prenatal Multi to fully support you and baby throughout pregnancy. Shop our Complete Plan and save.

settings.title: Why should I start a subscription? How does a subscription work?
settings.answer: Daily, continuous supplementation is needed to maintain optimal levels for you and your baby before, during, and after pregnancy. Our subscription ensures you never miss a day of optimal nourishment. We’ll send you an email each month, a few days before we charge you and ship your next box. You can delay an order, or cancel your subscription at any time, right from your account page.

settings.title: I’m not yet pregnant or a mama, is your product still for me?
settings.answer: Yes, our product is tailored for before, during, and after pregnancy, but it is beneficial at all stages of life. Research suggests that a mama’s habits prior to conception influence her baby’s well-being not just at birth, but also for her entire lifetime. Our Pre/Probiotic supports a healthy microbiome not only for mama and baby, but for generations to come. Mamas-to-be can benefit from improving their microbiome prior to conception and may receive benefits like balanced mood, optimized digestion, and healthy blood sugar and pressure.

settings.title: What happens if I miss a day? Or a few days?
settings.answer: Don't sweat it. We know how busy life can get. We suggest building your Pre/Probiotic consumption into an existing routine (like your morning smoothie), to keep the habit strong. Taking your Pre/Probiotic every day will provide positive, long-lasting results.

settings.title: What makes Needed's Prenatal Multi different from others?
settings.answer: We work directly with practitioners who regularly test mamas' nutrient levels before, during, and after pregnancy to know what's truly needed. Together, we have selected nutrient forms of 24 vitamins and minerals that work best in the body, and dosages intended to help you thrive, not just survive. Most prenatals are designed to meet bare minimum needs, and often contain inadequate nutrient amounts and tough-to-absorb forms.

settings.title: Why do you offer Iron separately?
settings.answer: We recommend taking Iron away from our Prenatal Multi, as Iron can interact negatively with other nutrients. We also recommend taking only as much as you need (some mamas do not need to supplement), as too much supplemental Iron can generate oxidative stress and alter the gut microbiome. Talk to your health practitioner about testing your Iron status before, during, and after pregnancy, and supplement if you are falling short. Our Iron is bound to Glycine for better absorption and digestive comfort.

settings.title: Why 8 Capsules?
settings.answer: 8 capsules allows our Prenatal Multi to deliver all of the vitamins, minerals, and botanicals needed for complete, comprehensive nourishment — many of the best nutrients are bulky and can’t fit into 1- or 2-a-day prenatal capsules. You’ll see that a number of nutrient dosages are quite unique including 400mg of Choline and 200mg of Magnesium. With our capsules, it is easy to divide the full dose among meals throughout the day.

settings.title: When should I start taking the Prenatal Multi?
settings.answer: Take it before, during, after pregnancy — and even beyond — for the nourishment you need to feel your best and avoid depletion, and to give your baby everything their body needs to thrive from the very start. We like to stress the importance of preconception nutritional preparation and postpartum recovery, so this product is for you even if you are a few years away from having kids or a few years postpartum.

settings.title: Why do the amounts of some of the nutrients in Prenatal Multi exceed the percent Daily Value?
settings.answer: We designed our Prenatal Multi to help you thrive, not just survive. Daily Values are set off of the Recommended Dietary Allowances (RDAs) which most often do not offer enough nutritional value for pregnant and nursing women.

settings.title: Is your Prenatal Multi vegan, allergen free, and Non-GMO?
settings.answer:
Our Prenatal Multi is vegetarian, but not vegan. There are considerable sustainability questions around the common vegan source of Vitamin D3, lichen. Lichen is a moss-like organism that exists as a composite of fungus and algae. It is an important part of the Arctic tundra ecosystem and grows "extremely slowly", less than a millimeter per year. For this reason, we prefer a “mind-fully made” D3 originally sourced from lanolin. 

It is allergen free, meaning no milk, egg, fish, shellfish, tree nuts, peanuts, wheat, soy, and gluten. It is also free of GMOs, artificial colors, artificial flavors, preservatives, and other additives and fillers.

settings.title: Can I give it to my partner?
settings.answer: Yes, we do. We’re working on a specific formula for the men in our lives that will have a few more sperm boosters. In the meantime, our Prenatal Multi paired with our Men's Omega-3+ and Men's Pre/Probiotic is a great start. Conception is a two-way street.

settings.title: Will the Prenatal Multi make my urine a bright yellow?
settings.answer: It may at times, especially with consistent use. B Vitamins in particular can cause urine to change to a bright yellow hue. Your body is excreting what it doesn’t need. We use nutrients forms that are most easily absorbed by the body, but because we set dosages to be fully supportive, the nutrient amounts may sometimes be more than you need. At our dosages, this is not harmful in any way, but just a guarantee you hit optimal amounts. Less is not more in our mind!

settings.title: Where is the Prenatal Multi Manufactured?
settings.answer: The Prenatal Multi is manufactured in the United States at a FDA, GMP and QAI Certified Organic facility.

settings.title: What kind of testing do you do?
settings.answer: We test every batch for performance and quality, including through third parties that test for nutritional content, pesticides and herbicides, heavy metals, microbes, allergens, and other contaminants.

settings.title: Everything makes me nauseous while I am pregnant, will your product work for me?
settings.answer: Many pregnant mamas find it helpful to take smaller doses throughout the day with meals (i.e. 3 with breakfast, 3 with lunch, 2 with dinner). Our pared down Prenatal Multi Essentials for first trimester nausea is coming soon!

settings.title: Why do you suggest taking more than just the Prenatal Multi?
settings.answer: Our Prenatal Multi is the most comprehensive available, but some extra support is always needed during this life stage. Our products are designed to be taken together. We recommend pairing the Prenatal Multi with our Omega-3+, Collagen Protein, and Pre/Probiotic to fully support you and baby before, during, and after pregnancy. Keeping the products separate allows us to maintain quality. For example, we find the Omega-3 (DHA + EPA) is compromised when taken out of the context and mixed into a multivitamin.

settings.title: Why should I start a subscription? How does a subscription work?
settings.answer: Daily, continuous supplementation is needed to maintain optimal levels for you and your baby before, during, and after pregnancy. Our subscription ensures you never miss a day of optimal nourishment. We’ll send you an email each month, a few days before we charge you and ship your next box. You can delay an order, or cancel your subscription at any time, right from your account page.

settings.title: I’m not yet pregnant or a mama, is your product still for me?
settings.answer: Yes, our product is tailored for before, during, and after pregnancy, but it is beneficial at all stages of life. Research suggests that a mama’s habits prior to conception influence her baby’s well-being not just at birth, but also for its entire lifetime. We recommend taking our Prenatal Multi prior to becoming pregnant to build your stores of key nutrients that are commonly depleted during pregnancy. The more you have prior to pregnancy, the better you may be able to feel during pregnancy.

settings.title: What happens if I miss a day? Or a few days?
settings.answer: Don't sweat it. We know how busy life can get. We suggest building your Prenatal Multi consumption into an existing routine (like your morning smoothie), to keep the habit strong. Taking your Prenatal Multi every day will provide positive, long-lasting results.

settings.title: Why should I purchase a plan?
settings.answer: Our plans provide the complete nutrition a mama (and dad!) need before, during, and after pregnancy. These plans are designed to optimally nourish you and baby to help you feel your best and help support baby’s development. With a single monthly shipment, you simplify your nourishment routine. And bonus, you save the most when you subscribe to our monthly plans.

settings.title: How should I choose between Needed Plans?
settings.answer:
The Complete Plan is for the mama that wants optimal nourishment covering micronutrient, microbiome, and protein needs. The Complete Plan offers the same Prenatal Multi and Omega-3 as the Starter Plan and also includes a Pre/Probiotic to support mama and baby’s microbiome and a Collagen Protein for protein support and skin and pelvic floor health.

The Starter Plan is a great introductory plan for those that want to focus on micronutrient needs.

Our Men's Support Plan is designed for sperm health and the dad behind them.

And, our Conception Support Plan is an option for making daily couples smoothies.

settings.title: How do your plans work?
settings.answer: Our plans ensure you never miss a day of optimal nourishment. Subscribe to one of our plans and we’ll send you an email each month, a few days before we charge you and ship your next box. You can delay an order, or cancel your subscription at any time, right from your account page.

settings.title: What if I only need one of the products in the plan?
settings.answer: Many mamas enjoy the completeness, savings, and convenience of the Plans but if you would like to customize your own nourishment, any item is available to purchase one-time or as a subscription.

settings.title: How often should I consume all of the products in my plan?
settings.answer: The products are designed to be consumed every day. You will receive a 30 day supply of each product in your plan, and plans are shipped monthly. If you are not able to consume all of your product in a month and need to delay your next subscription you can do so easily from your account page or by emailing hello@thisisneeded.com

We are committed to proving our products work, both in the lab through clinical-validation and third-party testing, as well as in the real lives of our customers and health practitioner community.

settings.title: Better products begin with better standards.
settings.description1: We deliver nutrients exactly as nature intended, from our ingredients selection, to nutrient pairings, to nutrient delivery at a molecular level.
settings.description2: We design products that are tailored to address your body’s specific needs during the lifestage of conception, through pregnancy and postpartum.

settings.description4: We validate our product in the lab—with clinical rigor and testing—and through real-world testing in the lives of our community of health practitioners, new mamas, and mamas-to-be.

settings.text: Before: it can play a huge role in optimizing your chances of conceiving (both women and men), by improving egg and sperm health, lowering inflammation, regulating hormones. It’s never too early to start preconception planning.
During: it can combat common pregnancy complications and help you to actually feel good throughout your pregnancy. The better nourished you are, the better you’ll feel (and it’s a long 10 months)!

After: Your body requires significant nourishment to repair after giving birth, to normalize hormone function, to balance your mood, and to restore nutrient stores in preparation for a future baby, on top of producing healthy breast milk.

settings.section_title: Pair our Iron with our Prenatal Multi
settings.description: Our Multi comes in Powder and Capsule form. It's the most complete Multi on the market, with 24 optimally dosed vitamins and minerals to help you thrive, not just survive.

settings.title: What makes Needed’s Prenatal Iron different than others?
settings.answer:
We offer an Iron bound to Glycine as Ferrous Bisglycinate Chelate (Ferrochel™) in 13.5mg capsules that allow you to more easily dose up or down as you need. 

Ferrous Bisglycinate Chelate is a mineral chelate in which Iron is bound to two Glycine amino acid molecules. It is easily absorbed by the body and, unlike most other Iron forms, it minimizes constipation and gastric upset.

settings.title: Why do you offer Iron separately from your Prenatal Multi?
settings.answer: We recommend taking Iron away from our Prenatal Multi, as Iron can interact negatively with other nutrients. We also recommend taking only as much as you need (some mamas do not need to supplement), as too much supplemental Iron can generate oxidative stress and alter the gut microbiome. Talk to your health practitioner about testing your Iron status before, during, and after pregnancy, and supplement if you are falling short. Our Iron is bound to Glycine for better absorption and digestive comfort.

settings.title: How do I know how much Iron I need?
settings.answer: Start by scrolling up and reviewing our dosage chart. This chart was created in partnership with a group of women’s health practitioners that regularly test women's Iron levels before, during, and after pregnancy.

settings.title: Is your Iron vegan, allergen free, and Non-GMO?
settings.answer: It is vegan and allergen free, meaning no milk, egg, fish, shellfish, tree nuts, peanuts, wheat, soy, and gluten are contained in the product. It is also free of GMOs, artificial colors, artificial flavors, preservatives, and other additives and fillers.

settings.title: What are the "other ingredients" in your Iron?
settings.answer: Iron as Ferrous Bisglycinate Chelate (Ferrochel™) is carried in vegetable capsules made from cellulose with a small amount of extra cellulose and the amino acid, L-Leucine, to help place the Iron into capsules.

settings.title: Where is your Iron manufactured?
settings.answer: Our Iron is manufactured in the United States at a FDA, GMP and QAI Certified Organic facility.

settings.title: What kind of testing do you do?
settings.answer: We test every batch for performance and quality, including through third parties that test for nutritional content, pesticides and herbicides, heavy metals, microbes, allergens, and other contaminants.

settings.title: I’ve found Iron really makes me nauseous while I am pregnant, will your product work for me?
settings.answer: Our Iron is the Ferrous Bisglycinate Chelate form, a mineral chelate in which Iron is bound to two Glycine amino acids. It is easily absorbed by the body and, unlike most other Iron forms, it minimizes constipation or gastric upset.

settings.title: Can I customize my subscription based on my monthly Iron needs?
settings.answer: Our subscriptions are flexible, you can easily adjust it to receive your Iron at a different cadence than our standard monthly delivery. Email us at hello@thisisneeded.com if you need help.

settings.page_sub_title: We make it easy to compare Powder and Capsules, and to switch your subscription between them.

settings.title: Why should I pre-order?
settings.answer: We are working hard to fully optimize our Prenatal Multi for you, and your preorder helps make this happen as we are a young company doing a lot of research and development. We also expect to have extremely high demand once our product is ready to ship, so getting your pre-order in now ensures it will be available for you. We anticipate shipping in early-December, and will keep you updated with an official delivery date.

settings.title: What makes Needed's Prenatal Multi different from others?
settings.answer: We work directly with practitioners who regularly test mamas' nutrient levels before, during, and after pregnancy to know what's truly needed. Together, we have selected nutrient forms of 24 vitamins and minerals that work best in the body, and dosages intended to help you thrive, not just survive. Most prenatals are designed to meet bare minimum needs, and often contain inadequate nutrient amounts and tough-to-absorb forms.

settings.title: Why do you offer Iron separately?
settings.answer: We recommend taking Iron away from our Prenatal Multi, as Iron can interact negatively with other nutrients. We also recommend taking only as much as you need (some mamas do not need to supplement), as too much supplemental Iron can generate oxidative stress and alter the gut microbiome. Talk to your health practitioner about testing your Iron status before, during, and after pregnancy, and supplement if you are falling short. Our Iron is bound to Glycine for better absorption and digestive comfort.

settings.title: Why powder?
settings.answer: Powder allows our Prenatal Multi to deliver all of the vitamins, minerals, and botanicals needed for complete, comprehensive nourishment — many of the best nutrients are bulky and can’t fit into 1- or 2-a-day prenatal capsules. You’ll see that a number of nutrient dosages are quite unique including 550mg of Choline and 400mg of Magnesium. Powder is more easily absorbed into the body. There is no need for additives or coatings. And, it tastes great and is seamless to incorporate into daily meals, drinks, or snacks (like smoothies, protein bites, nut milks, and more).

settings.title: When should I start taking the Prenatal Multi?
settings.answer: Take it before, during, after pregnancy — and even beyond — for the nourishment you need to feel your best and avoid depletion, and to give your baby everything their body needs to thrive from the very start. We like to stress the importance of preconception nutritional preparation and postpartum recovery, so this product is for you even if you are a few years away from having kids or a few years postpartum.

settings.title: Why do the amounts of some of the nutrients in Prenatal Multi exceed the percent Daily Value?
settings.answer: We designed our Prenatal Multi to help you thrive, not just survive. Daily Values are set off of the Recommended Dietary Allowances (RDAs) which most often do not offer enough nutritional value for pregnant and nursing women.

settings.title: Is your Prenatal Multi vegan, allergen free, and Non-GMO?
settings.answer: Our Prenatal Multi is vegetarian, but not vegan. There are considerable sustainability questions around the common vegan source of Vitamin D3, lichen. Lichen is a moss-like organism that exists as a composite of fungus and algae. It is an important part of the Arctic tundra ecosystem and grows \"extremely slowly\", less than a millimeter per year. For this reason, we prefer a “mind-fully made” D3 originally sourced from lanolin. It is allergen free, meaning no milk, egg, fish, shellfish, tree nuts, peanuts, wheat, soy, and gluten. It is also free of GMOs, artificial colors, artificial flavors, preservatives, and other additives and fillers.

settings.title: What "other ingredients" are included in your Prenatal Multi?
settings.answer: We are thoughtful about every ingredient we use, including our OTHER INGREDIENTS. Citric Acid: Citric acid exists in a variety of fruits and vegetables. We use citric acid to enhance flavor. We source our citric acid from a natural fermentation process, not the commonly used corn source. Medium Chain Triglycerides from Organic Coconut Oil: MCT oil delivers short chain fatty acids providing creaminess, while being easy to digest. This purified oil contains no allergens. Acacia Fiber: Acacia fiber is a type of soluble fiber harvested from the sap of the Acacia tree. It is well tolerated and supports the texture of the powder. Natural Vanilla Flavor: Delicious vanilla taste on its own, or a great base to add other flavors like cocoa or berry to suit your taste buds. Modified Tapioca Starch: Modified tapioca starch is a hydrolyzed starch from the roots of the cassava plant. It is included in one of our vitamins to aid mixability of the powder. We use tapioca to avoid starch sourced from corn or grains. Monk Fruit Extract: Monk fruit, or Lo Han Guo, is a small round fruit native to southern China. This fruit has been used for centuries in traditional Chinese medicine. We use a small amount, about 0.6% by weight per serving, of 100% extract from the fruit to add a little sweetness to the powder. Monk fruit causes no blood sugar spike. (Be careful that many will claim to be using monk fruit, but mix it with erythritol or xylitol.) Cellulose and Cellulose Wax: Cellulose, the main constituent of plant cell walls and vegetable fibers, form beadlets to encapsulate our Vitamin C for optimal nutrient delivery and protection. Sunflower Oil: Sunflower oil is the oil pressed from the seeds of sunflower. One of our vitamins contains sunflower oil for stability. Overall, it makes up less than 0.2% of a serving by weight. Annatto: Annatto extracted from the seeds of the achiote tree provides the pink coloring of our Vitamin C beadlets.

settings.title: Can I give it to my partner?
settings.answer: Yes, we do. We make a “couples smoothie” almost every morning. We’re working on a specific formula for the men in our lives that will have a few more sperm boosters like CoQ10. In the meantime, our Prenatal Multi paired with our Omega-3 and Collagen Protein is a great start. Conception is a two-way street. (We then separately take our Pre/Probiotic.)

settings.title: Will the Prenatal Multi make my urine a bright yellow?
settings.answer: It may at times, especially with consistent use. B Vitamins in particular can cause urine to change to a bright yellow hue. Your body is excreting what it doesn’t need. We use nutrients forms that are most easily absorbed by the body, but because we set dosages to be fully supportive, the nutrient amounts may sometimes be more than you need. At our dosages, this is not harmful in any way, but just a guarantee you hit optimal amounts. Less is not more in our mind!

settings.title: Where is the Prenatal Multi Manufactured?
settings.answer: The Prenatal Multi is manufactured in the United States at a FDA, GMP and QAI Certified Organic facility.

settings.title: What kind of testing do you do?
settings.answer: We test every batch for performance and quality, including through third parties that test for nutritional content, pesticides and herbicides, heavy metals, microbes, allergens, and other contaminants.

settings.title: Everything makes me nauseous while I am pregnant, will your product work for me?
settings.answer: Many pregnant mamas find our product more pleasant to take than a pill, and can often find something palatable to mix the powder into, even while nauseated. It is simple to incorporate the powder into the meals or beverages that sound appealing like smoothies, meals, protein bites, etc.

settings.title: Why do you suggest taking more than just the Prenatal Multi?
settings.answer: Our Prenatal Multi is the most comprehensive available, but some extra support is always needed during this life stage. Our products are designed to be taken together. We recommend pairing the Prenatal Multi with our Omega-3 powder, Collagen Protein, and Pre/Probiotic to fully support you and baby before, during, and after pregnancy. Keeping the products separate allows us to maintain quality. For example, we find the Omega-3 (DHA + EPA) is compromised when taken out of the context (our liposomes keep the Omega-3 in their natural context) and mixed into a multivitamin

settings.title: Why should I start a subscription? How does a subscription work?
settings.answer: Daily, continuous supplementation is needed to maintain optimal levels for you and your baby before, during, and after pregnancy. Our subscription ensures you never miss a day of optimal nourishment. We’ll send you an email each month, a few days before we charge you and ship your next box. You can delay an order, or cancel your subscription at any time, right from your account page.

settings.title: I’m not yet pregnant or a mama, is your product still for me?
settings.answer: Yes, our product is tailored for before, during, and after pregnancy, but it is beneficial at all stages of life. Research suggests that a mama’s habits prior to conception influence her baby’s well-being not just at birth, but also for its entire lifetime. We recommend taking our Prenatal Multi prior to becoming pregnant to build your stores of key nutrients that are commonly depleted during pregnancy. The more you have prior to pregnancy, the better you may be able to feel during pregnancy.

settings.title: What happens if I miss a day? Or a few days?
settings.answer: Don't sweat it. We know how busy life can get. We suggest building your Prenatal Multi consumption into an existing routine (like your morning smoothie), to keep the habit strong. Taking your Prenatal Multi every day will provide positive, long-lasting results.

settings.title: How do I track my package, and what happens if it goes missing?
settings.answer: We've partnered with Route, the leader in package protection and tracking solutions, to guarantee your products make it safely into your hands. We've covered the cost of Route+ on your order so it will be protected from damage, loss*, or theft. In the unfortunate case that your order never comes or is broken upon arrival, you can easily file a claim with Route and receive a replacement or be fully reimbursed. We are excited to offer this service to you at no additional cost! Claims for packages marked "delivered" must be filed after 5 days and before 15 days from the date the package was marked "delivered." Claims for packages presumed to be lost (where the status is not "delivered") must be filed after 7 (20 for international) days and within 30 days from the last checkpoint. You will receive an email from Route after your purchase with instructions on how to download Route’s mobile app for iOS from the App Store to visually track your package and receive real-time notifications on its estimated delivery.

settings.heading: Why test your levels
settings.description: For most mamas in pregnancy, 4,000IU of D3 is the most effective supplement dosage and highly safe in meeting Vitamin D needs. Our Prenatal Multi is dosed at this level (most other prenatals are dosed insufficiently). Some mamas, due to genetics, diet, geography, life stage (while nursing we recommend at least 6,000IU) or other factors, may need or benefit from a higher dosage. Testing and retesting your levels empowers you to better understand your unique Vitamin D needs, as a first step in optimizing you and your baby’s wellbeing.

settings.section_title: How it works
settings.section_subtitle: Our simple and safe blood collection method does not require a full blood draw or a trip to the doctor. Three drops of blood from a finger prick is all that's needed to assess your Vitamin D status.

settings.item_desc: Vitamin D levels start changing as soon as you change your diet, supplementation, and sun exposure routine.
Personalized dietary recommendations based off your test results.
All samples are processed in a central CLIA-certified laboratory.

Accuracy of the test assessed quarterly with DEQAS (Vitamin D External Quality Assessment Scheme), www.deqas.org, an international organization established in 1989 to ensure analytical reliability of Vitamin D tests.
Reference ranges show you how you compare to your peers.

settings.section_title: We've partnered with OmegaQuant, the leading experts on at-home Vitamin D nutrient testing.
settings.section_desc: OmegaQuant is an independent, CLIA-certified lab that offers Vitamin D testing to researchers, clinicians and the public and sets the standard for at home Vitamin D testing.
settings.section_bottom_text: Read more about why we partnered with OmegaQuant.

settings.title: What's included with the test?
settings.answer: The test kit includes a blood collection card, lancet, alcohol pad, gauze pad, bandage, and a prepaid return envelope. See here.

settings.title: What will my results tell me?
settings.answer: The results will provide you with the total Vitamin D amount in your blood, which is equivalent to 25-hydroxyvitamin D in plasma.

settings.title: What is the target range for Vitamin D results?
settings.answer:
Vitamin D blood level in the 30-50 ng/ml, which is equivalent to 75 - 125 nmol/L, is one indicator of better overall health. Many of our practitioner partners like seeing levels even above 50ng/ml / 125 nmol/L, including up to 80ng/ml / 200 nmol/L.
A double blind, randomized clinical trial found that Vitamin D supplementation of 4,000IU/day for pregnant women was safe and most effective in achieving sufficiency in all women and their babies regardless of race or geography. Vitamin D levels of 80 nmol/L ( 30 ng/ml) or greater within 1 month of delivery was considered sufficient in the study.
Another double blind, randomized clinical trial found that Vitamin D supplementation of 6,400IU/day for nursing women was safe and most effective in achieving adequate Vitamin D levels in women to satisfy their nursing infants. However, Vitamin D levels of <50 nmol/L (20 ng/ml) was defined as deficient in this study, so many nursing moms may need to supplement with more Vitamin D to achieve optimal levels.

settings.title: Why should I take this test rather than a blood-draw test ordered by my doctor?
settings.answer: We use three drops of blood to measure your Vitamin D level. This eliminates the need to have your blood drawn at a clinic. You can collect your sample and send it through the mail from the comfort of your own home! And, it is highly accurate. Our testing partner, OmegaQuant, has led research on at-home blood testing for 30 years, and validates accuracy of the test quarterly with DEQAS (Vitamin D External Quality Assessment Scheme), www.deqas.org, an international organization established in 1989 to ensure analytical reliability of Vitamin D tests.

settings.title: Does the finger prick hurt?
settings.answer: The prick creates a slight pinch.

settings.title: Are there any risks to testing my Vitamin D levels?
settings.answer:
There is minimal physical risk to you from the finger prick. The prick may cause a small amount of pain and bruising, and the site may bleed slightly for a time after the blood is collected. There is also a very rare chance that the stick site could become infected. If this happens, you might require medical treatment.
There is a very small risk associated with the collection of confidential health information. However, we are making every effort to protect your identity.

settings.title: How long will it take to receive my results?
settings.answer: Your results will be ready within 2 to 3 weeks of our lab receiving your results by mail.

settings.title: How often should I re-rest my Vitamin Dlevels?
settings.answer: We suggest retesting every 3-4 months, especially as needs change throughout pregnancy and postpartum. Outside of pregnancy and nursing, when your Vitamin D levels reach a desirable range, we recommend re-testing every 6 months.

settings.title: If I am deficient, how long will it take to improve my Vitamin D levels?
settings.answer:
It can often take 3-4 months of regular supplementation to up Vitamin D levels. We suggest retesting after 3-4 months to check if you need to increase your dosage. 
For pregnancy, we suggest supplementing with a minimum of 4,000IU of Vitamin D (The amount in our Prenatal Multi). A double blind, randomized clinical trial found that Vitamin D supplementation of 4,000IU/day for pregnant women was safe and most effective in achieving sufficiency in all women and their babies regardless of race or geography. 
For postpartum, we  suggest supplementing with a minimum of 6,000IU of Vitamin D (a separate Vitamin D supplement is recommended - we will have one soon!) Another double blind, randomized clinical trial found that Vitamin D supplementation of 6,400IU/day for nursing women was safe and most effective in achieving adequate Vitamin D levels in women to satisfy their nursing infants.
Some mamas, due to genetics, diet, geography, life stage, current Vitamin D levels, or other factors, may need or benefit from a higher dosage. Testing can help determine how much extra is needed.

settings.title: Is it possible that my Vitamin D levels will be too high?
settings.answer:
It is possible, but rare. Vitamin D blood levels >100 ng/mL (250 nmol/L) are above the recommended range and may lead to toxicity symptoms
For pregnancy, we suggest supplementing with a minimum of 4,000IU of Vitamin D (The amount in our Prenatal Multi). A double blind, randomized clinical trial found that Vitamin D supplementation of 4,000IU/day for pregnant women was safe and most effective in achieving sufficiency in all women and their babies regardless of race or geography. 
For postpartum, we  suggest supplementing with a minimum of 6,000IU of Vitamin D (a separate Vitamin D supplement is recommended - we will have one soon!) Another double blind, randomized clinical trial found that Vitamin D supplementation of 6,400IU/day for nursing women was safe and most effective in achieving adequate Vitamin D levels in women to satisfy their nursing infants.
Some mamas, due to genetics, diet, geography, life stage or other factors, may need or benefit from a higher dosage. Testing can help determine how much extra is needed.

settings.title: To improve Vitamin D levels you recommend supplementing. What about if I eat dairy and spend a lot of time in the sun?
settings.answer: It can be difficult to reach optimal Vitamin D levels through food and sun exposure. For example, a glass of milk has 100IUs, so you'd need 40 glasses a day (not recommended!) to reach the optimal baseline per day for pregnancy, 4,000IU (and 60 while nursing!). And, with the sun, you'd need to have pale skin, be outside with bare skin and no sunscreen at midday for hours every day to synthesize enough. This is not realistic for most modern mamas.

settings.title: What is your privacy policy, and how will my results be used by Needed and OmegaQuant?
settings.answer: The results of your test will be kept strictly confidential. Your results from the test are personal and private. Records will be kept confidential to the extent provided by federal, state, and local law. Only relevant Needed and OmegaQuant team members will have the right to look at your individual test results and records. Your results will be grouped with the results from other individuals’ tests into a study. Needed and OmegaQuant may share results of this study in marketing, meetings, journals or other forums, but your individual identity will remain secret.

settings.title: What is Omega-3?
settings.answer: Omega-3 is a critical fat for before, during, and after pregnancy. You cannot make Omega-3, and must obtain it from diet or supplementation. There are three main types of Omega-3, ALA, DHA, and EPA. ALA is found in plants like chia seeds, flax seeds, and walnuts. ALA needs to be converted into the DHA and EPA forms of Omega-3 in order to be used by the body. This conversion process is highly inefficient (often less than 1%), so it is important for you to consume DHA and EPA directly. Fatty fish and supplements are the two reliable dietary sources. Fish do not make the DHA and EPA, but instead bioaccumulate them from eating algae.

settings.title: How do I know if I need Omega-3?
settings.answer: Our testing kit can help. Many are surprised to find that even if they eat a lot of salmon and sardines, their Omega-3 levels are lower than optimal. Our’s were! And, research shows that up to 95% of women are deficient, and men can be too. Even if you are not deficient, the more Omega-3 in your diet the better you will feel and the healthier your sperm will be.

settings.answer: Our products are designed to be taken together for optimal nutrition. We recommend pairing the Men's Omega-3+ with our Men's Pre/Probiotic+ and our Men's Multi to fully support you during the preconception period and the dad years to come. Shop our Men's Plan and save.

settings.title: What is Omega-3?
settings.answer: Omega-3 is critical fat for before, during, and after pregnancy. You cannot make Omega-3, and must obtain it from diet or supplementation. There are three main types of Omega-3, ALA, DHA, and EPA. ALA is found in plants like chia seeds, flax seeds, and walnuts. ALA needs to be converted into the DHA and EPA forms of Omega-3 in order to be used by the body. This conversion process is highly inefficient (often less than 1%), so it is important for mom and baby to consume DHA and EPA directly. Fatty fish and supplements are the two reliable dietary sources. Fish do not make the DHA and EPA, but instead bioaccumulate them from eating algae.

settings.title: How do I know if I need Omega-3?
settings.answer: Our testing kit can help. Many are surprised to find that even if they eat a lot of salmon and sardines, their Omega-3 levels are lower than optimal. Our’s were! And, research shows that up to 95% of women are deficient. Even if you are not deficient, the more Omega-3 in your diet the better you will feel, especially when you are building baby as ⅓ of his or her brain is made of Omega-3.

settings.title: Why is the dosage set at 400mg DHA + 100mg EPA?
settings.answer:
We set our dosage in partnership with leading scientists and health practitioners across modalities (including MDs, NDs, nutritionists, Chinese medicine doctors, midwives, and other birth work professionals) based on research and in-practice experience. Our 400mg of DHA conforms to the American Pregnancy Association per day recommendation. A combination of DHA to EPA allows us to provide multiple benefits for mom and baby, as DHA and EPA have different and often complementary physiological effects. And, as an added benefit to our Omega-3+, the capsules provide a good source of Choline at 100mg plus Lutein and Zeaxanthin, which all work synergistically to support mama and baby.
We recognize that some practitioners recommend higher dosages of Omega-3 for before, during and after pregnancy which is why we suggest doubling the dose for a period of time if your levels are low.

settings.title: Is your Omega-3+ vegan, allergen free, and Non-GMO?
settings.answer: Our Omega-3 is vegan, we source it from algae. Fish actually don’t make their own Omega-3 they just bioaccumulate it from algae. It is allergen free, meaning no milk, egg, fish, shellfish, tree nuts, peanuts, wheat, soy, and gluten. It is also free of GMOs, artificial colors, artificial flavors, preservatives, and other additives and fillers.

settings.title: What kind of testing do you do?
settings.answer: Our Omega-3+ is expertly formulated and clinically validated by 10+ years of research and development, including through third-party clinical studies. We test every batch for performance and quality, including through third parties that test for nutritional content, pesticides and herbicides, heavy metals, microbes, allergens, and other contaminants.

settings.title: Everything makes me nauseous while I am pregnant, will your product work for me?
settings.answer: Many pregnant mamas find our capsules pleasant to take as they are smaller than standard fish oil pills, flavored with bergamot and do not have a fishy aftertaste. However, do not stress if nothing is working for you in your early pregnancy, as baby draws most of the Omega-3 it needs in the third trimester, so you can pause your subscription and restart once your nausea has passed (soon, we hope!)

settings.title: Why should I start a subscription? How does a subscription work?
settings.answer: Daily, continuous supplementation is needed to maintain optimal Omega-3 levels for you and your baby before, during, and after pregnancy. Our subscription ensures you never miss a day of optimal nourishment. We’ll send you an email each month, a few days before we charge you and ship your next box. You can delay an order, or cancel your subscription at any time, right from your account page.

settings.title: What products work best with the Omega-3+?
settings.answer: Our products are designed to be taken together for optimal nutrition. We recommend pairing the Omega-3+ with our Prenatal Multi, Pre/Probiotic, and Collagen Protein to fully support you and baby throughout pregnancy.

settings.title: I’m not yet pregnant or a mom, is your product still for me?
settings.answer: Yes, our product is tailored for before, during, and after pregnancy, but it is beneficial at all stages of life. Research suggests that a mom’s habits prior to conception influence her baby’s well-being not just at birth, but also for its entire lifetime. At every stage of life, the more Omega-3 in your diet, the better you will feel. So, it’s never too early to start a subscription.

settings.title: What happens if I miss a day? Or a few days?
settings.answer: Don't sweat it. We know how busy life can get. You can go ahead and double-up the dose for any days missed. Going forward, we recommend that you try to take your Omega-3 everyday to see positive, long-lasting results.

settings.title: Why do I need a Pre/Probiotic?
settings.answer: A strong and healthy microbiome is needed for fertility, sperm health, and overall wellness. What you eat is the number one determiner of microbiome health, but it can be difficult to get enough of certain key strains from food. Our tailored Pre/Probiotic provides the targeted strains you need.

settings.title: How is your Pre/Probiotic designed for dads and dads-to-be?
settings.answer: Our Pre/Probiotic is formulated in partnership with leading microbiome experts to provide the targeted strains needed for fertility, sperm health, and overall wellbeing of dad. It is formulated to promote hormone balance, fertility, sperm health, immune function, optimized digestion, and to support healthy blood sugar.

settings.title: Is your Pre/Probiotic vegan, allergen free, and Non-GMO?
settings.answer: It is vegan and allergen free, meaning no milk, egg, fish, shellfish, tree nuts, peanuts, wheat, soy, and gluten. It is also free of GMOs, artificial colors, artificial flavors, preservatives, and other additives and fillers.

settings.title: Where is the Pre/Probiotic manufactured?
settings.answer: The Pre/Probiotic is manufactured in the United States at a FDA, GMP and NSF Certified facility.

settings.title: Do I need to refrigerate the Pre/Probiotic?
settings.answer: We suggest storing at room temperature or cooler. Refrigeration is not necessary unless your home is consistently 79° F or warmer for extended periods.

settings.title: Are the capsules enteric coated?
settings.answer: No, the capsules are not enteric coated. Research shows that our strains do not require enteric coated capsules to deliver the same benefits. The capsules are just a delivery system. That's why it's okay to open them up.

settings.title: Could I experience some discomfort at the start of taking the Pre/Probiotic?
settings.answer:
Possible symptoms may include abdominal cramping, loose stools, and changes in bowel movements. Though these symptoms may be uncomfortable, they are a sign that the product is working! Symptoms should resolve within 2-3 days.

We suggest taking the capsules as follows for your system to adjust: Week 1: Take 1 capsule every other day, Week 2: Take 1 capsule daily, Week 3+: Take 2 capsules daily.

settings.title: What makes Needed’s Prenatal Vitamin D3/K2 different from others?
settings.answer: We use optimal nutrient forms paired at an optimal ratio for the perinatal life stage. Plus, our D3 + K2 comes in smaller capsules for easy taking and dosage tailoring.

settings.title: Why do you offer Vitamin D3/K2 separately from your Prenatal Multi?
settings.answer: For most mamas in pregnancy, 4,000IU of D3 and 90mcg of K2 per day (2 capsules) is highly effective and safe. Our Prenatal Multi is dosed at this level. Some mamas, due to genetics, diet, geography, life stage (while nursing we recommend at least 6,000IU / 135mcg) or other factors, may need or benefit from a higher dose.

settings.title: How do I know how much Vitamin D3/K2 I need?
settings.answer: Start by scrolling up and reviewing our dosage chart or by testing your Vitamin D3 levels. This chart and ratio of Vitamin D3/K3 was set in partnership with a group of women’s health practitioners that regularly test women's nutrients levels before, during, and after pregnancy.

settings.item_content: Retinyl Palmitate is an active form that is more readily usable by the body. Beta Carotene is often poorly absorbed and inefficiently converted into the active form. And, many women have a genetic variation that prevents the conversion completely. Our combination provides enough Retinyl Palmitate to be effective, while still being safe for all mamas and mamas-to-be.

settings.item_content: Vitamin D3 is technically not a vitamin, but a prohormone. Prohormones are the building blocks of fully formed hormones. Your skin produces Vitamin D3 when it is exposed to sunlight. But, most mamas don't get enough sun and Vitamin D is difficult to get from food. In addition, many women contain genetic variations that predispose them to lower levels of Vitamin D. Vitamin D3 is more readily used by the body than Vitamin D2. Our dose provides enough to be effective, while still being safe for all mamas and mamas-to-be.

settings.item_content: Vegan or vegetarian mamas have decreased dietary intake of Riboflavin. Deficiencies observed in clinical practice supports our higher dosage. The Riboflavin family are the precursors of the coenzymes, flavin adenine dinucleotide (FAD) and flavin mononucleotide (FMN). We use both forms to support production of both coenzymes as Riboflavin contributes the flavin to FAD and Riboflavin-5-Phosphate is synonymous to FMN.

settings.item_content: Methylfolate paired with Glucosamine Salt is bioavailable and ready to be used by the body. We avoid Folic Acid, as it is unusable or harmful for many mamas. The unmethylated Folate form found in plants is not readily converted into the usable Methylfolate form. Our dosage provides enough Folate to be effective, especially for those with conversion difficulty, while still being safe for all mamas and mamas-to-be. While too little Folate can lead to mood imbalances, so can too much Folate.
