settings.item_content: Adenosylcobalamin and Methylcobalamin are the two active coenzyme forms that are readily usable by the body. Adenosylcobalamin supports energy and a healthy metabolism, and is often missing in prenatals. Cyanocobalamin, the more common form of B12, consists of a harmful compound that requires additional processing for safe removal from the body. We avoid this form. Our combination provides enough Vitamin B12 to be highly supportive, while still being safe for all mamas and mamas-to-be.

settings.item_content: Magnesium Glycinate, specifically Magnesium BisGlycinate, is a mineral chelate where the Magnesium is bound to two glycine amino acids. This form is better absorbed and gentler to digest than other forms of Magnesium. Some other forms, like Magnesium Oxide, can be so poorly absorbed that they can cause loose stools and inhibit the absorption of other nutrients. We do not recommend taking more than 400mg at once, as higher dosages may slow the nutrient’s absorption.

settings.page_title: Powder or Pills—or just the Essentials?

settings.card_description: Complete nutrition for before, during, and after pregnancy
The Prenatal Multi and Omega-3 you need for before, during, and after pregnancy

settings.header_title: Or, complete your Prenatal Multi with a plan designed for an optimal you.

settings.section_title: Ready to talk to your health practitioner about our better Prenatal Multi Essentials?

settings.title: Why did you design the Prenatal Multi Essentials. How is it different from your Prenatal Multi (Powder and Capsules)?
settings.answer: We get it, sometimes taking a handful of pills just won't cut it (hello, first trimester nausea). We pared down our complete Prenatal Multi (eight capsules or powder) to just the essentials you and your baby need. Our Prenatal Multi Essentials is the most nourishing prenatal available in just three pills, with optimal nutrient forms and meaningful dosages of the critical nutrients. If you can, we suggest taking our Prenatal Multi at all stages. But, when our Prenatal Multi doesn’t fit your budget or routine, you will be better supported with our Prenatal Multi Essentials than almost any other prenatal on the market. Like our other products, we worked directly with practitioners who regularly test nutrient levels to select every nutrient form and dose.

settings.title: When should I start taking the Prenatal Multi Essentials?
settings.answer: Take it before, during, after pregnancy — and even beyond — for the nourishment you need to feel your best and avoid depletion, and to give your baby everything their body needs to thrive from the very start. We like to stress the importance of preconception nutritional preparation and postpartum recovery, so this product is for you even if you are a few years away from having kids or a few years postpartum.

settings.title: Why do you offer Iron separately?
settings.answer: We recommend taking Iron away from our Prenatal Multi Essentials, as Iron can interact negatively with other nutrients. We also recommend taking only as much as you need (some mamas do not need to supplement), as too much supplemental Iron can generate oxidative stress and alter the gut microbiome. Talk to your health practitioner about testing your Iron status before, during, and after pregnancy, and supplement if you are falling short. Our Iron is bound to Glycine for better absorption and digestive comfort.

settings.title: Why do the amounts of some of the nutrients in Prenatal Multi Essentials exceed the percent Daily Value?
settings.answer: We designed our Prenatal Multi Essentials to help you thrive, not just survive, even when 8 pills isn't an option. Daily Values are set off of the Recommended Dietary Allowances (RDAs) which most often do not offer enough nutritional value for women, especially while pregnant or nursing.

settings.title: Is your Prenatal Multi Essentials vegan, allergen free, and Non-GMO?
settings.answer: Our Prenatal Multi is vegetarian, but not vegan. There are considerable sustainability questions around the common vegan source of Vitamin D3, lichen. Lichen is a moss-like organism that exists as a composite of fungus and algae. It is an important part of the Arctic tundra ecosystem and grows "extremely slowly", less than a millimeter per year. For this reason, we prefer a “mind-fully made” D3 originally sourced from lanolin. It is allergen free, meaning no milk, egg, fish, shellfish, tree nuts, peanuts, wheat, soy, and gluten. It is also free of GMOs, artificial colors, artificial flavors, preservatives, and other additives and fillers.

settings.title: What “other ingredients” are included in your Prenatal Multi Essentials?
settings.answer: Our Prenatal Multi Essentials is free of gross additives and fillers. It’s made with vegetable capsules and includes only L-Leucine, an amino acid, to help with flow.

settings.title: Will the Prenatal Multi Essentials make my urine a bright yellow?
settings.answer: It may at times, especially with consistent use. B Vitamins in particular can cause urine to change to a bright yellow hue. Your body is excreting what it doesn’t need. We use nutrients forms that are most easily absorbed by the body, but because we set dosages to be fully supportive, the nutrient amounts may sometimes be more than you need. At our dosages, this is not harmful in any way, but just a guarantee you hit optimal amounts. Less is not more in our mind!

settings.title: Where is the Prenatal Multi Essentials Manufactured?
settings.answer: The Prenatal Multi is manufactured in the United States at a FDA, GMP and QAI Certified Organic facility.

settings.title: What kind of testing do you do?
settings.answer: We third party test every batch for performance and quality, including nutritional content, pesticides and herbicides, heavy metals, microbes, allergens, and other contaminants.

settings.title: Do you suggest taking more than just the Prenatal Multi Essentials?
settings.answer: We designed our Prenatal Multi Essentials to be taken with our Omega-3+, Collagen Protein, and Pre/Probiotic. Together these products optimally support your preconception and general health. We suggest upgrading to our Prenatal Multi, if you can. And, many mamas may benefit from adding Iron or extra Vitamin D3/K2.

settings.title: Why should I start a subscription? How does a subscription work?
settings.answer: Daily, continuous supplementation is needed to maintain optimal nutritional levels. Our subscription ensures you never miss a day of optimal nourishment. We’ll send you an email each month, a few days before we charge you and ship your next box. You can delay an order, or cancel your subscription at any time, right from your account page.

settings.title: Everything makes me nauseous while I am pregnant, will your product work for me?
settings.answer: We know, even 3 pills can be hard. We suggest taking 1 per meal, if you can. Many pregnant mamas also find our Prenatal Multi Powder to be more pleasant to take than pills, and can often find something palatable to mix the powder into, even while nauseated. It is simple to incorporate the powder into the meals or beverages that sound appealing like smoothies, meals, protein bites, etc.

settings.title: I’m not yet pregnant or a mama, is your product still for me?
settings.answer: Yes, our product is tailored for before, during, and after pregnancy, but it is beneficial at all stages of life. Research suggests that a mama’s habits prior to conception influence her baby’s well-being not just at birth, but also for its entire lifetime. We recommend taking our Prenatal Multi Essentials prior to becoming pregnant to build your stores of key nutrients that are commonly depleted during pregnancy. The more you have prior to pregnancy, the better you may be able to feel during pregnancy.

settings.title: What happens if I miss a day? Or a few days?
settings.answer: Don't sweat it. We know how busy life can get. We suggest building your Prenatal Multi Essentials consumption into an existing routine (like your morning smoothie), to keep the habit strong. Taking your Prenatal Multi Essentials every day will provide positive, long-lasting results.

settings.section_title: Ready to talk to your health practitioner about our better Prenatal Multi?

settings.title: What makes Needed’s Men’s Multi different from others?
settings.answer: We work directly with practitioners who regularly test nutrient levels to select every nutrient form and dose. Most multis are designed to meet bare minimum needs, and often contain inadequate nutrient amounts and tough-to-absorb forms.

settings.title: When should I start taking the Men’s Multi?
settings.answer: It’s never too early to start (or too late), but we suggest 3 months before trying to conceive at a minimum. It takes 90 days for sperm to mature, and during this period they are vulnerable. Sperm health impacts conception outcomes and the health of a growing baby.

settings.title: Why do the amounts of some of the nutrients in the Men’s Multi exceed the percent Daily Value?
settings.answer: Daily Values are set off of the Recommended Dietary Allowances (RDAs) which most often do not offer enough nutritional value to support optimal nutritional levels. We work directly with practitioners who regularly test nutrient levels to select every nutrient form and dose.

settings.title: Why is the Men’s Multi 4 caps, but the Prenatal Multi contains 8?
settings.answer: We work directly with practitioners who regularly test nutrient levels to select every nutrient form and dose. Due to higher meat and overall general calorie consumption, they found men to be less deficient than women in a number of key nutrients. Men can take our prenatal multi instead, if they want additional support, but most prefer our 4 capsule tailored version.

settings.title: Is your Men’s Multi vegan, allergan free, and non GMO?
settings.answer: Our Men’s Muli is vegetarian, but not vegan. There are considerable sustainability questions around the common vegan source of Vitamin D3, lichen. Lichen is a moss-like organism that exists as a composite of fungus and algae. It is an important part of the Arctic tundra ecosystem and grows "extremely slowly", less than a millimeter per year. For this reason, we prefer a “mind-fully made” D3 originally sourced from lanolin. It is allergen free, meaning no milk, egg, fish, shellfish, tree nuts, peanuts, wheat, soy, and gluten. It is also free of GMOs, artificial colors, artificial flavors, preservatives, and other additives and fillers.

settings.title: What “other ingredients” are included in your Men’s Multi?
settings.answer: Our Men’s Multi is free of gross additives and fillers. It’s made with vegetable capsules and includes only L-Leucine, an amino acid, to help with flow.

settings.title: Will the Men’s Multi make my urine bright yellow?
settings.answer: It may at times, especially with new consistent use. B Vitamins in particular can cause urine to change to a bright yellow hue. Your body is excreting what it doesn’t need. We use nutrients forms that are most easily absorbed by the body, but because we set dosages to be fully supportive, the nutrient amounts may sometimes be more than you need. At our dosages, this is not harmful in any way, but just a guarantee you hit optimal amounts. Less is not more in our mind!

settings.title: Where is the Men’s Multi Manufactured?
settings.answer: The Men’s Multi is manufactured in the United States at a FDA, GMP and QAI Certified Organic facility.

settings.title: What kind of testing do you do?
settings.answer: We third party test every batch for performance and quality, including nutritional content, pesticides and herbicides, heavy metals, microbes, allergens, and other contaminants.

settings.title: Do you suggest taking more than just the Men’s Multi?
settings.answer: We designed our Men’s Multi to be taken with our Men’s Omega-3+ and Men’s Pre/Pro+. Together these products optimally support your preconception and general health.

settings.title: Why should I start a subscription? How does a subscription work?
settings.answer: Daily, continuous supplementation is needed to maintain optimal nutritional levels. Our subscription ensures you never miss a day of optimal nourishment. We’ll send you an email each month, a few days before we charge you and ship your next box. You can delay an order, or cancel your subscription at any time, right from your account page.

settings.title: I’m not a dad or dad-to-be, is your product still for me?
settings.answer: Yes, it’s a great Multi for all men. Beyond sperm health, nutritional deficiencies can compromise everything from libido to brain function to hair coverage. We work directly with practitioners who regularly test nutrient levels to select every nutrient form and dose. Most multis are designed to meet bare minimum needs, and often contain inadequate nutrient amounts and tough-to-absorb forms.

settings.title: What happens if I miss a day? Or a few days?
settings.answer: Don't sweat it. We know how busy life can get. We suggest building your Men’s Multi consumption into an existing routine, to keep the habit strong. Taking your Multi every day will provide positive, long-lasting results.

settings.title: I just found out I am pregnant, should I discontinue use?
settings.answer: This product is intended for use before and after pregnancy, not during pregnancy. If you are taking it prior to conception, simply stop use when you learn you are pregnant (taking it a few weeks between conception and your first positive pregnancy test is just fine) and restart postpartum.

settings.title: 4 capsules is a lot for me on top of my other Needed products, can I take 2?
settings.answer: Yes! The product required 4 capsules to give fully supportive dosing, but taking just 2 per day is still absolutely beneficial. You can also split-up the dose, taking the capsules throughout the day, with or without food.

settings.title: I’m not yet pregnant or a mama, is your product still for me?
settings.answer: Yes! It is designed for you. This product is intended for use before and after pregnancy, not during pregnancy. It is highly supportive in preconception phase, or just general female hormone balance and stress support before you are evening thinking about trying to conceive.

settings.title: Is your Stress Support vegan, allergen free, and Non-GMO?
settings.answer: Yes, it is vegan and free of allergens, GMO, gluten, and gross fillers.

settings.title: Can I take the Stress Support on top of your other products?
settings.answer: Absolutely. Our products work best together. We suggest taking the Stress Support on top of our Complete Plan whenever possible.

settings.title: Is this safe for breastfeeding?
settings.answer:
We suggest consulting with your doctor/midwife before taking it while breastfeeding. However, we designed the product with breastfeeding mamas in mind. The safety of these botanicals is understudied in the clinical literature during breastfeeding, so in designing this product we looked at:
- History of safe traditional use
- No history of adverse events from case reports, clinical studies
- No identified concerns from the botanical’s mechanism of action
- No innately toxic constituents
- Historical in-practice use by our community of practitioners
- Strong benefits for mamas at this stage

settings.title: Why are organic rice hulls and organic rice extract included in the product?
settings.answer: Sometimes additional ingredients are used for ease of manufacturing. These two rice-based ingredients provide necessary flow on the manufacturing line to get the botanicals into the capsules. Rice offers a much cleaner alternative to Magnesium Stearate and other common gross additions. We try to be thoughtful about every ingredient we use.

settings.title: Can I give it to my male partner?
settings.answer: While it is not dangerous to give to your male partner, we suggest just sharing with your female-friends. This product is really designed to balance the female body before and after pregnancy, and well into your mom years.

settings.title: Where is your Stress Support manufactured?
settings.answer: Our Stress Support is manufactured in the United States at a FDA, GMP and NSF Certified facility.

settings.title: What kind of testing do you do?
settings.answer: We third party test every batch for performance and quality, including nutritional content, pesticides and herbicides, heavy metals, microbes, allergens, and other contaminants.

settings.title: Why should I start a subscription?
settings.answer: Daily, continuous supplementation is needed to maintain optimal nutritional levels. Our subscription ensures you never miss a day of optimal nourishment. We’ll send you an email each month, a few days before we charge you and ship your next box. You can delay an order, or cancel your subscription at any time, right from your account page.

settings.title: What happens if I miss a day? Or a few days?
settings.answer: Don't sweat it. We know how busy life can get. We suggest building your Stress Support consumption into an existing routine to keep the habit strong. Taking your Stress Support every day will provide positive, long-lasting results. And, the botanicals do work better with consistent, cumulative use.

settings.conent:
we started Needed to change the perinatal nutrition paradigm. As life-long nutrition nerds, we were shocked to discover that we were nutrient deficient as we began our journeys to motherhood.

We quickly realized we were far from alone—97% of pregnant women take a prenatal supplement, yet 95% are nutrient deficient. Existing prenatal vitamins aren’t cutting it for mamas and babies.

And, most women don’t have access to the information they need. We’re talking credible information from perinatal health experts, not Dr. Google!

So we got to work, partnering with women’s health practitioners to redesign perinatal supplements, education, and an awesome customer experience from the ground-up.

Our Practitioner Referral Program is vital to our mission of optimally nourishing all women before, during, and after pregnancy.

As a Referral Partner, you’ll be making money (or donating it to our women’s health research efforts, as you choose!) while helping mamas and their families get the optimal nourishment that’s needed.

We are so excited to partner with you!

We deliver better products and information, in close collaboration with our community of women’s health practitioners, advocates, and researchers. Together, we’re empowering optimal nourishment and changing the perinatal nutrition paradigm for the better.

settings.title: What makes Needed’s CoQ10 different from others?
settings.answer: We use Ubiquinol, which is the most bioavailable form, accounting for over 90% of CoQ10 in your blood. The more common supplement form, Ubiquinone, must be converted to Ubiquinol by the body before it's absorbed.

settings.title: When should I start taking CoQ10?
settings.answer: It’s never too early to start (or too late), but we suggest 3 months before trying to conceive at a minimum. It takes 90 days for sperm to mature, and during this period they are vulnerable. Sperm health impacts conception outcomes and the health of a growing baby.

settings.title: Should I take 1 or 2 capsules?
settings.answer: Each softgel contains 200 mg of Ubiquinol. Both doses of 1 or 2 softgels (200mg and 400 mg) have been studied for their safety and efficacy. The 200 mg offered in 1 softgel serves as a supportive dose and may be a desired place to start if this is your first time taking CoQ10, or as a maintenance dose. The 400 mg offered in 2 softgels provides additional support and may be desired if you have less lead time prior to conception, or known health conditions that may be supported by CoQ10.

settings.title: Is your CoQ10 vegan, allergen free, and non-GMO?
settings.answer: Our CoQ10 is vegetarian but not vegan. It contains gelatin and beeswax, both of which are derived from high quality animal sources. It is allergen free, meaning no milk, egg, fish, shellfish, tree nuts, peanuts, wheat, soy, and gluten. It is also free of GMOs, artificial colors, artificial flavors, preservatives, and other additives and fillers.

settings.title: What “other ingredients” are included in your Men’s Multi?
settings.answer: Our CoQ10 is free of gross additives and fillers. It’s made with vegetable capsules and includes only Medium Chain Triglycerides, Gelatin, Ascorbyl Palmitate (a fat soluble form of Vitamin C), Glycerin, Sunflower Lecithin, Annatto (a carotenoid-rich compound made from the seeds of the achiote tree), And Beeswax.

settings.title: Why should I take it with food?
settings.answer: CoQ10 is a fat-soluble compound, so taking it with food can help your body absorb it more efficiently and effectively.

settings.title: Where is your CoQ10 Manufactured?
settings.answer: Our CoQ10 is manufactured in the United States at a FDA, GMP and QAI Certified Organic facility.

settings.title: What kind of testing do you do?
settings.answer: We third party test every batch for performance and quality, including nutritional content, pesticides and herbicides, heavy metals, microbes, allergens, and other contaminants.

settings.title: Is CoQ10 safe to take with other supplements?
settings.answer: We designed our products to be taken together. We encourage men and women to take our CoQ10 alongside our Multis, Omega-3+, and Pre/Probiotics. Together these products optimally support your preconception, perinatal, and general health.

settings.title: Why should I start a subscription? How does a subscription work?
settings.answer: Daily, continuous supplementation is needed to maintain optimal nutritional levels. Our subscription ensures you never miss a day of optimal nourishment. We’ll send you an email each month, a few days before we charge you and ship your next box. You can delay an order, or cancel your subscription at any time, right from your account page.

settings.title: We already got pregnant, is your product still for me?
settings.answer: For men with partners who are currently pregnant, CoQ10 has a number of healthy benefits beyond fertility that can benefit you now and well into your upcoming dad years, including energy and metabolic health, heart health, and more. For women who are currently pregnant, we recommend consulting with your provider prior to taking CoQ10.

settings.title: Prenatal nutrition isn't always accessible. So we're changing that for mamas in need.

settings.heading: The Prenatal Nutrition Gap
settings.description:
Prenatal vitamins are essential to the health of mama and baby, but they aren’t all created equally. 97% of pregnant women take a prenatal, yet 95% have nutrient deficiencies. High quality prenatals are often not covered by health insurance (the prescription options leave out many nutrients, and tend to include harmful fillers).


Access to high quality nutrition is a right, not a privilege. But we know that access to optimal perinatal nutrition is inequitable, particularly when combined with the high costs of other necessities on the journey to parenthood - like the medical costs of fertility treatments, surrogacy, miscarriage, and birth.


While change is needed to shift the perinatal paradigm, system-wide change takes time.

settings.heading: So, we’re stepping up to support the journey of those who need us the most.
settings.description:
It’s our way of working to close the perinatal nutrition gap.


We’re giving away a one year’s supply of our Prenatal Multi to 25 women who may not otherwise have access to a comprehensive prenatal.


Every woman nominated will qualify for a FREE perinatal nutrition consultation with our experts.

settings.heading: Change is Needed
settings.description: We acknowledge that this is just a start. But several small steps in the right direction can influence real change. Learn more about what we and our collective of practitioners are doing to change the perinatal nutrition paradigm

settings.item_content: Biotin is a B vitamin that helps turn the carbohydrates, fats, and proteins in the food you eat into energy.

• active in energy metabolism
  • cofactor for enzymes involved in many metabolic pathways
  • plays a role in fatty acid and carbohydrate metabolism
  • formation of keratin and development of epidermal cells and hair and nails, improving their condition

settings.item_content: Choline is a critical nutrient that is often missing from multivitamins since it is bulky and can be difficult to formulate with. Dietary sources of Choline are quite low, so most women could benefit from a supplement.
settings.support_mama_content:
• healthy metabolism

  • healthy blood pressure

• normal thyroid function
  • healthy metabolism

settings.item_content: Magnesium Glycinate, specifically Magnesium BisGlycinate, is a mineral chelate where the Magnesium is bound to two glycine amino acids. This form is better absorbed and gentler to digest than other forms of Magnesium. Some other forms, like Magnesium Oxide, can be so poorly absorbed that they can cause loose stools and inhibit the absorption of other nutrients.

  • fertility and conception

settings.item_description: as 50% Beta Carotene and as 50% Retinyl Palmitate
settings.item_content: Retinyl Palmitate is an active form that is more readily usable by the body. Beta Carotene is often poorly absorbed and inefficiently converted into the active form. And, many women have a genetic variation that prevents the conversion completely.
settings.support_mama_content:
• immune function
  • healthy skin and vaginal tissues
  • thyroid function
  • production of hormones like estrogen and progesterone

settings.item_content: Adenosylcobalamin and Methylcobalamin are the two active coenzyme forms that are readily usable by the body. Adenosylcobalamin supports energy and a healthy metabolism, and is often missing in multivitamins. Cyanocobalamin, the more common form of B12, consists of a harmful compound that requires additional processing for safe removal from the body. We avoid this form.
settings.support_mama_content:
• energy levels
  • healthy metabolism
  • cognitive health
  • managing stress

settings.item_content: Ascorbic Acid is the main form of Vitamin C found naturally in fruit and other foods.
settings.support_mama_content:
• immune function
  • antioxidant - prevents cell damage
  • healthy connective tissues and skin (collagen synthesis)
  • iron absorption
  • mental health as a component of neurotransmitter biosynthesis
  • metabolism and healthy energy levels

settings.item_content: Vitamin D3 is technically not a vitamin, but a prohormone. Prohormones are the building blocks of fully formed hormones. Your skin produces Vitamin D3 when it is exposed to sunlight. But, most women don't get enough sun and Vitamin D is difficult to get from food. In addition, many women contain genetic variations that predispose them to lower levels of Vitamin D. Vitamin D3 is more readily used by the body than Vitamin D2.
settings.support_mama_content:
• immune function
  • calcium and phosphorus absorption
  • immune function
  • calcium and phosphorus absorption
  • bind and eliminate toxins
  • healthy blood pressure

settings.item_content: Tocopherols are antioxidants that occur naturally in foods such as nuts, seeds, and leafy green vegetables. We source ours from rapeseed oil rather than the more commonly found soybean oil. We provide 64mg of mixed tocopherols overall, with 30mg from d-alpha tocopherols declared as Vitamin E.
settings.support_mama_content:
• healthy skin
  • anti-aging
  • healthy neurological function
  • normal cardiac function
  • healthy lipid profiles
  • normal inflammatory response

settings.item_content: Vitamin K2 as MK-7 (Menaquinone-7). MK-7 is found in fermented vegetables like natto and produced by healthy colonic bacteria. It lasts longer in the body than other forms of Vitamin K2.
settings.support_mama_content:

settings.section_title: Ready to talk to your health practitioner about our better Women's Multi?

settings.title: When should I take the Women’s Multi?
settings.answer: We recommend our Prenatal Multi when you are preparing to conceive (ideally 6-12 months in advance), actively trying to conceive, pregnant, or postpartum (6 months after birth, or 3 months after weaning).  Our Women's Multi is an optimal choice for all other stages of womanhood.

settings.title: Why do you offer Iron separately?
settings.answer: We recommend taking Iron away from our Women’s Multi, as Iron can interact negatively with other nutrients. We also recommend taking only as much as you need (some women do not need to supplement), as too much supplemental Iron can generate oxidative stress and alter the gut microbiome. Talk to your health practitioner about testing your Iron status, and supplement only if you are falling short. Our Iron is bound to Glycine for better absorption and digestive comfort.

settings.title: Why do the amounts of some of the nutrients in Women’s Multi exceed the percent Daily Value?
settings.answer: We designed our Women’s Multi to help you thrive, not just survive. Daily Values are set off of the Recommended Dietary Allowances (RDAs) which most often do not offer enough nutritional value for women. Learn more here.

settings.title: Is your Women’s Multi vegan, allergen free, and Non-GMO?
settings.answer: Our Women’s Multi is vegetarian, but not vegan. There are considerable sustainability questions around the common vegan source of Vitamin D3, lichen. Lichen is a moss-like organism that exists as a composite of fungus and algae. It is an important part of the Arctic tundra ecosystem and grows "extremely slowly", less than a millimeter per year. For this reason, we prefer a “mind-fully made” D3 originally sourced from lanolin. It is allergen free, meaning no milk, egg, fish, shellfish, tree nuts, peanuts, wheat, soy, and gluten. It is also free of GMOs, artificial colors, artificial flavors, preservatives, and other additives and fillers.

settings.title: What “other ingredients” are included in your Women’s Multi?
settings.answer: Our Women’s Multi is free of gross additives and fillers. It’s made with vegetable capsules and includes only L-Leucine, an amino acid, to help with flow.

settings.title: Will the Women’s Multi make my urine a bright yellow?
settings.answer: It may at times, especially with consistent use. B Vitamins in particular can cause urine to change to a bright yellow hue. Your body is excreting what it doesn’t need. We use nutrient forms that are most easily absorbed by the body, but because we set dosages to be fully supportive, the nutrient amounts may sometimes be more than you need. At our dosages, this is not harmful in any way, but just a guarantee you hit optimal amounts.

settings.title: Where is the Women’s Multi manufactured?
settings.answer: The Women’s Multi is manufactured in the United States at a FDA, GMP and QAI Certified Organic facility.

settings.title: What kind of testing do you do?
settings.answer: We third party test every batch for performance and quality, including nutritional content, pesticides and herbicides, heavy metals, microbes, allergens, and other contaminants.

settings.title: Do you suggest taking more than just the Women’s Multi?
settings.answer: We designed our Women’s Multi to be taken safely alongside our range of women’s health products. We recommend combining our Women’s Multi with our Omega-3+ for optimal energy, hormone and brain health, and beauty, and a healthy immune response. For more comprehensive nourishment, we recommend our Women’s Health Plan.

settings.title: Why should I start a subscription? How does a subscription work?
settings.answer: Daily, continuous supplementation is needed to maintain optimal nutritional levels. Our subscription ensures you never miss a day of optimal nourishment. We’ll send you an email each month, a few days before we charge you and ship your next box. You can delay an order, or cancel your subscription at any time, right from your account page.

settings.title: I’m thinking about becoming pregnant soon, is this the right product for me?
settings.answer: The Women’s Multi is tailored for before and beyond pregnancy. It is beneficial in the preconception phase to build your stores of key nutrients that are commonly depleted during pregnancy. Furthermore, research suggests that a mama’s habits prior to conception influence her baby’s well-being not just at birth, but also for its entire lifetime. The more you have prior to pregnancy, the better you may be able to feel during pregnancy. For more comprehensive nourishment, we recommend our Prenatal Multi Capsules or Powder.

settings.title: What happens if I miss a day? Or a few days?
settings.answer: Don't sweat it. We know how busy life can get. We suggest building your Women’s Multi consumption into an existing routine (like taking it with breakfast), to keep the habit strong. Taking your Women’s Multi every day will provide positive, long-lasting results.

settings.title: What makes Needed’s Choline different from others?
settings.answer: We use the optimal nutrient forms of Choline L(+) Bitartrate VitaCholine™. Plus, our Choline comes in 250mg capsules for easy dosage tailoring.

settings.title: Why do you offer Choline separately from your Prenatal Multi?
settings.answer: 95%+ of mamas are not meeting their Choline needs. The RDA or daily minimum is 450mg/550mg while pregnant/nursing, and research suggests that consuming upwards of 900mg in pregnancy supports optimal perinatal and infant health outcomes. Choline is not found abundantly in many foods, so many mamas can benefit from a supplement. For optimal absorption, we suggest taking no more than 500mg of Choline in one serving across all of your products.

settings.title: How do I know how much Choline I need?
settings.answer: Start by scrolling up and reviewing our dosage chart and compare it with your daily intake through food and supplements.

settings.title: Is your Choline vegan, allergen free, and Non-GMO?
settings.answer: It is vegetarian and allergen free, meaning no milk, egg, fish, shellfish, tree nuts, peanuts, wheat, soy, and gluten are contained in the product. It is also free of GMOs, artificial colors, artificial flavors, preservatives, and other additives and fillers.

settings.title: What are the “other ingredients” in your Choline?
settings.answer: Our Choline is carried in vegetable capsules made from cellulose with a small amount of the amino acid, L-Leucine, to help place the nutrients into capsules.

settings.title: Where is your Choline manufactured?
settings.answer: Our Choline is manufactured in the United States in a GMP Certified facility.

settings.title: What kind of testing do you do?
settings.answer: We test every batch for performance and quality, including through third parties that test for nutritional content, pesticides and herbicides, heavy metals, microbes, allergens, and other contaminants.
